loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou is a 34-year-old mother of three children. Two of them are in school while the other one is too young to go to school yet. She has been a rice farmer for more than five years, living in Kampong Cham province. Her income is about 50,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and has fully repaid the loans. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en: Na is a 33-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is in school. They all live in Kampong Cham province, in Cambodia. Growing rice is the only source of her family’s income for more than five years and it earns her about 31,000 KHR per day. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes to gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samean

texts.en:
Samean, a resident living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 34 years old and is a married mother of two children. Both of them are dependent on her and still in school. 

For a living, Samean grows cassava as her main source of income. She also grows paddy rice as a supplement job. She has been in these jobs for 16 years. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is seeking a loan to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and to pay for plowing fees and workers, and to buy school supplies for her children. She hopes that she can expand her business and be able to keep her children in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and to pay for plowing fees and workers

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, a farmer living in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, is 24 years old. She is married and has one daughter.  The main source of her income is from growing rice on three hectares of farmland. She sometimes works as a paid worker in order to supplement her income. 

Sokhorn has been involved in this job for four years; she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to support her living. 

This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. She hopes that she can earn more income and save it as capital for a future time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Yong is 40 years old and the mother of one child. She grows cassava as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via rice cropping. She earns about 31,700 KHR per day. 

Yong leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can expand her cassava farm so that it is bigger than before.

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Cham province, Eng is 53 years old and the mother of four dependent children. To support her living conditions, she earns income via cassava growing and rice cropping. 

In this group of four, Eng is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides, and to pay for plowing the farm. She hopes that she can expand her farm so that it is bigger than before.

This is Eng's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides, and to pay for plowing the farm.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Phea is 25 years old and the mother of one kid. She earns income to support her family’s living via growing cassava. She also grows rice to earn extra income. 

Phea leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can expand her farm to get more income.

This is Phea's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Samorn's Group

texts.en:
Samorn, 46, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children. Samorn struggles to make a living for her family via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. 

She leads a group of three members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and laborer's fees. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle so that it is better than last year.

This is Samorn's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan as well.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and laborer's fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khea's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Khea is 44 years old. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and selling grocery items. Moreover, she can earn extra income by working for others for a fee. 

This is Khea's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for reselling. She hopes that she can improve her family's condition to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for reselling.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun is a 56-year-old mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. They all live in Kampong Cham province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows cassava and works on another farm for a fee for more than five years. She could earn about 80,700 KHR per day. Due to the depreciated value of the cassava price on market, her income also was decreased. Now she has not enough funds to work on the farm, so she decided to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income to expand her cassava farming and improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Leakhena's Group

texts.en:
Leakhena, 32, lives with family members in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children. 

Leakhena earns income to support her living conditions via growing rice. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy more land to expand her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education.

This is Leakhena's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

loans.use: to buy more land to expand her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Soukhim's Group

texts.en:
Soukhim, who is a farmer living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 29 years old. She is a married mother of two dependent children. One of her children is in school and the other one is too young to attend school. Soukhim grows cassava as her main source of income. She also grows rubber trees in order to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. 

In this group of two, Soukhim is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides, and to pay for plowing fees and paid workers. She hopes that she is able to expand her two businesses so that they are bigger, and to buy a new walking tractor.

This is Soukhim's second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides, and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is 45 years old and she lives in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of four dependent children, one of whom is in school.

Chhun is raising 15 pigs as the main source of her income. Besides that, she is growing paddy rice on two-hectares of farmland to supplement her income. 

She has been involved in this job for 25 years. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has fully repaid her past loans. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy pig feed, piglets, and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes that she can have enough capital to do her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer who lives in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Nhor is 36 years old. She is a widow mother of two dependent children; both of her children are studying. 

She struggles for a living and grows cassava as the main source of her income. Moreover, she grows rice to supplement her income. Her 21-year-old business earns her about 16,700 KHR per day to support her family. 

For Nhor, this is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has successfully repaid her past loans. A leader of a group of three members, Nhor is seeking a new loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and to pay for plowing fees. 


She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 31, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gerardo, her business partner. The couple works hard to provide for their everyday needs and to prepare for a better future.  

Maricel is in the food business, and has operated a hamburger and snack stand for the past two years. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Maricel sells hamburgers and makes "siomai" (Chinese pork dumplings) and "siopao" (steamed pork buns) to sell at her snack stand. Filipinos love to eat "siomai" and "siopao" as their snacks, and they are usually sold in busy areas such as in the plaza or near schools. Maricel cooks well - that is why her food stall is popular in her area. Neighbors and the local working community are her regular customers. 

Maricel earns a minimum of 700 PHP net income per day. To help her maintain her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients such as fresh meat, flour, wanton wrappers and condiments, which are required to make her snack food. 

Maricel dreams to have her own house and lot. She prays that God will bless the work of her hands to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and financial help, for it will surely help her in her business, and thus to cover her family's daily sustenance.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to make "siomai" (pork dumplings) and "siopao" (steamed pork buns) to sell.

loans.name: Sengan's Group

texts.en:
Sengan, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 52 years old and a mother of three children. To support her living conditions, she grows cassava and rice as her main source of income. 

In a group of three members, Sengan is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can expand on her cassava farm to make it bigger than before.

This is the third cycle for Sengan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Phae's Group

texts.en:
Phae, a farmer living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 59 years old. He is a father of four children. 

To make a living, Phae is growing cassava, his main business, to earn income. To supplement his income, he grows paddy rice as well. He has been involved in these businesses for 41 years. In fact, he can earn about 21,200 KHR per day from his businesses. 

This is the first time for him to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, Phae, the group leader, is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for the plowing fees. He hopes that he can expand his current business to get more yields.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for the plowing fees.

loans.name: Humberto Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Humberto es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo; construyo los muebles con sus propias manos y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos, además de poder arreglas y adecuar su taller.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en comprarse una vivienda propia.

Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Humberto is an experienced carpenter who over many years has learned this skill thanks to experience obtained working in many workshops. Over time he was becoming independent and started his own workshop in which, despite adversity, he has been successful together with his family.

His greatest pride is having built a good reputation and prestige thanks to his good work; making furniture with his own hands and almost everything in his humble home is made in the same way.

He is requesting a loan to purchase wood that enables him to make more furniture and achieve a good profit for his work, and also to manage and adapt his workshop.

His biggest dream is focused on buying a home of his own.

Always thinking of Interactuar as an ally and partner in the production process.

loans.use: to purchase wood that enables him to make more furniture.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros a través de catálogos.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
For Paola, what she wants from life is very clear. She is determined to get ahead and have a good life. She works selling various merchandise such as clothing and accessories such as wallets, some cosmetics, and more, by catalog. 

She started this activity in order to seek resources she needed to support herself. She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a wide variety of merchandise and thus have inventory available to sell to her customers. She hopes to progress as a businesswoman and have more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a wide selection of merchandise and thus have inventory available to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es:
Liliana, de 27 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la marroquinería gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fábricas donde trabajaba como operaria.

Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección de artículos de cuero.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar es su hijo.

Ella se dedica a su negocio todos los días durante 11 horas con dos empleados.

Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de una auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de algunos insumos de trabajo como cuero, agujas, entre otros.

Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Liliana is 27 years old. She has a lot of experience in the area of leather goods thanks to her multiple jobs in different factories where she worked as an operator. Today she is an independent woman and she earns her own income by making leather items. She is a very enterprising woman and her biggest motivation for working is her son. 

She works at her business every day for 11 hours and she has two employees. She has a lot of products that she wants to finish as soon as possible, but to do this, she needs some financial help to allow her to inject capital into her business by buying some work materials such as leather, needles, and more. 

With this loan, she will be able to keep her activity going and keep offering employment to people in her area.

loans.use: to buy some work materials such as leather, needles, and more.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
A senhora Hortencia, é comerciante, māe solteira de 02 filhos, em idade escolar, vive na casa proprio, sustenta ainda a māe e irmôos enviando.
Diz que com o valor quer comprar arroz, feijao, peixe, frangos e refrigerantes para reforçar  o negocio. 
Diz que quer bcrescer no negocio respondendo as necessidades dos seus clientes  .
 Diz que com o valor anterior melhorou a sua casa,  principais desafios insufienciencia de fundos, doencas, e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassa los  ira levantar mais creditos como forma de alcancar seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a businesswoman and a single mother to two children who are school aged. She lives in her own home and still supports her mother and her siblings by sending them money.

Hortencia says that she would like to buy rice, beans, fish, chicken and soft drink with this loan to restock her store. She says that wants to extend her store and respond to her customers' needs. 

Hortencia says that she made home improvements with her previous loan. Her main challenges are insufficient funds, illness, and the high cost of living which she will have to overcome to apply for more loans as a way of meeting her goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, fish, chicken and soft drink

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
O senhor  Joao de 47 anos de idade, casado pai de 3 filhos todos  a frequentar o ensino primario. vive na casa propria sustenta, a sua māe e um sobrinho .
Diz que com este credito ira comprar  pintos, racoes, vacinas e serradura, para ampliar a criacao de frangos ). 
Diz que seu sonho e ser um grande criador de frangos .
Principais desafios insufienciencia de fundos e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassa los  ira levantar mais creditos como forma de alcancar seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Joao is 47 years old, married and the father of three children who all go to primary school. Joao lives in his own home and supports his mother and a nephew. 

Joao says that this loan will go towards buying chicks, feed, vaccines and sawdust to increase the amount of chickens he raises. He says that his dream is to raise many chickens. 

Joao's main challenges are insufficient funds and the high cost of living which he will have to overcome to apply for more loans to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, vaccines and sawdust

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A 53-year-old farmer who is living in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Hoeurn is a married mother of five children. There are two children who are dependent on her and they are in school. She grows rice on two hectares of farmland to earn income. To supplement her family’s income, she sometimes works for others for a fee.

Hoeurn has been involved in her main business for 13 years, and she can earn about 31,300 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group representative, she is will use her loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing fees and paid workers. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing fees and paid workers

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una mujer emprendedora y aplicado, desde hace 4 años comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 

Ella vive en el municipio de Medellín con su hija de 12 años a la cual manifiesta que desea darle un futuro estable.

El trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 5:00 Pm atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar una moto para poder realizar domicilios y de éste modo poder ofrecer un empleo.

Esta ayuda le permitirá mejorar su servicio y ventas, apóyala hoy!
texts.en:
Martha is an enterprising and diligent woman. Four years ago, she began selling fruit and vegetables which, to date, has given her very good results. 

She lives in the municipality of Medellín with her 12-year-old daughter to whom she says she wants to give a stable future.

She works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM serving a moderately high number of customers.

She asks for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to be able to make deliveries and in this way be able to provide a job.

This help will allow her to improve her service and sales. Support her today!

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to make deliveries and in this way be able to provide a job.

loans.name: Celinda Josefa

texts.es:
Celina ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.

Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo ropa y zapatos, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para su hijo.

Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de, calzado, ropa entre otros al por mayor para tener mejor inventario.

Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Es una mujer fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Celina has had to deal with many adversities in the process of developing her business. 

Today, she lives in a humble house and earns her living selling clothing and footwear, work that she learned empirically with the desire to get sustenance for her child.

She works 8 hours daily at her business.

She asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of footwear, clothing, and more, in bulk to have a better inventory. 

With this loan, she will offer her products and improve her sales considerably. 

She is a strong woman with a great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to purchase footwear, clothing, and more, in bulk to have a better inventory.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Tem 46 anos, vive maritalmente, mãe de 7 filhos maiores, vive à base de negócio e conta com ajuda do esposo que é pedreiro por conta própria e com uma carrinha com a qual presta serviços de transporte para reforçar a renda de casa. vive na casa própria e esta a repetir o crédito  pela terceira  vez sendo que os anteriores investiu no negocio aumentando seu stock .
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar arroz, açúcar,  óleo,  omo, etc para ampliar o seu negocio que faz numa banca no mercadinho no local  onde mora.
Ela gostaria de poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio e adquirir mais bens para o seu lar de maneiras a poder ter mais credito.
Tem como desafio o  custo de vida, que considera ser alto, o facto de ter ainda um capital muito reduzido para o seu negocio, mas mesmo assim tem lutado para manter a sua confiança com a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She is 46 years old, married and the mother of seven adult children. She makes a living from running her business. Her husband, who is a mason and works independently, helps her. She also has a van and offers transport services to contribute to the family income. She owns the house where she lives and this is the third time she receives a loan. She invested the previous loans in increasing her quantities of stock.

With this loan she plans to buy rice, sugar, vegetable oil, laundry detergent, etc. and expand her business. She has a stall at the local marketplace.

She would like to be able to develop her business even more and purchase more goods for her home in order to get access to more loans. She faces the challenge of the cost of life, which she considers to be high, and the lack of capital for her business. However, she has fought to keep the confidence that Hluvuku has put in her.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, vegetable oil, laundry detergent, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Flor De La Canela Group

texts.es:
Filomena es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones de 20 y 15 años y una hija mujer de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de telas para la confección de polleras para cholita.
Ella es buena madre, buena oyente, paciente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ área central situada al este de la ciudad, reúne a gran parte de los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Filomena es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste suéter color crema y pollera roja). Su vida la disfruta con su esposo que trabaja como contratista albañil y con sus hijos; el mayor trabaja y estudia y los menores estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto en alquiler construido de ladrilo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como: taller de costura, venta de productos cosméticos, elaboración de colchones,  venta de chamarras, confección de delantales, venta de chompas de alpaca y venta de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de telas para la confección de polleras de cholita; Ella aprendió a confeccionar ropa de cholita, polleras, blusas y algunas mantas por el lapso de un año, luego abrió un taller en su casa, con sus propios fondos y con el apoyo de su familia.  Su taller de costura está ocupado por una máquina plisadora, una recta, dos pequeñas mesas y sus fierros que le permiten un perfecto plisado de las típicas polleras de cholita que se usan en la zona, “nunca creí en tan poco tiempo tendría mi propio taller de costura y que realizaría trabajos para vender en otras ciudades…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas continuas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de telas por mayor. Su sueño es fabricar sus propias telas artesanalmente, ella desea realizar la compra de tela por mayor para cumplir con los pedidos pendientes para las próximas festividades patronales. Esta es la 15 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Filomena solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para cumplir con sus pedidos y fabricar sus propias telas
texts.en:
Filomena is a 39 year old married woman with two sons aged 20 and 15 and a 10 year old daughter. Her business is selling fabric to make polleras (traditional skirts worn by indigenous women).

She is a good mother, a good listener, patient, supportive, responsible and hard-working. She does her business in the ‘16 de julio’ area, a center located to the east of the city which has a large amount of administrative buildings, businesses and Social Service offices. It has a cold and dry climate with a daily temperature that varies between 0 to 12 degrees Celsius.

Filomena is dark-skinned, has dark eyes, long black hair that she braids, low in height, and robust in build. She uses traditional clothing (skirt, hat and shawl) Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (She is seated in the photo in the center with a cream colored sweater and a red skirt).

She lives her life with her husband who works as a contract bricklayer and her children who study at school. They live in a rented room made out of brick and cement with a metal roof that has running water, electricity, gas and sewage. Her desire to get ahead led her to head a communal bank of people with businesses like: a sewing workshop, selling cosmetic products, making mattresses, selling jackets, making aprons, selling alpaca sweaters and selling skirts, who got together to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling fabric to make traditional skirts (polleras) worn by indigenous women. She learned to sew traditional clothing skirts, blouses and some shawls for one year. Then she opened a shop in her house with her own funds and the support of her family. Her sewing workshop is filled with a pleating machine, an overlock machine, two small tables and her irons that allow her to make perfect pleats on the traditional skirt that is used in the area. “I never thought that I would have my own workshop in such a short time and do work that is sold in other cities” she commented. The advantage of her business is that it has constant sales. Her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy fabric wholesale.

Her dream is to fabricate her own hand-made fabrics. She wants to buy fabric wholesale to fill outstanding orders for the upcoming saint Day festivities. This is her 15th loan with the institution in the 10 years she has been in business. For these reasons Filomena is requesting a loan to buy fabric wholesale to fill outstanding orders and fabricate her own fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale to fill her orders and fabricate her own cloth.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 
Desde hace 9 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas.

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su única hija. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Sandra manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman who is dedicated to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead, overcoming various obstacles that have arisen.

Nine years ago, she began her own business, a beauty salon, in addition she offers in-home service, according to her customers' needs. She works 8 hours daily.

This has allowed her to generate sufficient income to support her husband in the household economic responsibilities and pay for her only daughter's needs.

The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of a hairdryer and supplies in bulk (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, and more). This will allow her to continue with her work and offer a more complete service to her customers, in a more flexible and efficient way, which will increase the profit margin that she sees for her work.

Sandra states that her greatest desire is to be able to continue with her work, become accredited, and strengthen her business to become more competitive in the market and, so, have the capacity to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdryer and supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah started her coffee and donut shop, Olympic Trading Post, three years ago because she loves cooking and people.  She lives with her husband, and dedicates herself to her business every single day. 

She will use this loan to launch a marketing campaign and expand the potential of her business. Deborah always focuses on customer satisfaction, and hopes to have one of the best coffee and donut shops in her area.

loans.use: to launch a marketing campaign for her donuts and coffee shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the most advanced technology for her security system business

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi, tiene como actividades económicas una venta de productos de la canasta básica y el cultivo de maíz y frijol, está desarrollando este negocio desde hace varios años, por lo general trabaja en un horario de seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde; actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y uno de sus hijos, todos sus hijos son independientes y no cuenta con ayuda económica del extranjero.
Está solicitando un crédito en Padecomsm para realizar la compra de abono, pesticidas e insecticidas, con estos materiales podrá sembrar y dar un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos de granos básicos, su objetivo es fortalecer su negocio para aumentar la rentabilidad de tal manera que pueda cumplir con el pago de su deuda.
Los sueños que Daysi tiene son ir mejorando poco a poco su negocio y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daysi has as work the sale of basic pantry items and the cultivation of corn and beans. She has been developing this business for some years. In general, she works on a schedule of six in the morning until six at night. She lives with her life partner and one of her children. All of her children are independent and she doesn't have any support from abroad.

She is asking Padecomsm for a loan to purchase manure, pesticides, and insecticides; with these materials she will be able to plant and give her crops of basic grains good development. Her goal is to strengthen her business to increase the profits in such as way that she can pay off her debt.

Daysi's dreams are to continue improving her business little by little and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, and insecticides; with these materials she will be able to plant and give her crops of basic grains good development.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de37 años de edad, criada y nacida en el campo, es madre de 4 hijos los hombres de 19, 17 y 3 y la mujer de 7, ella se dedica a su crianza, prepara los alimentos, los despacha para la escuela, los típicos cuidados de una madre.

Sonia se encuentra solicitando un préstamo la razón es que quiere iniciar un negocio de cría de aves para apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia e incrementar su calidad de vida, ellos son personas humildes que trabajan diariamente 10 horas para poder llevar el alimento a su hogar, lo que busca Sonia es brindar esperanzas a su familia, la ilusión, de decirles a sus hijos si es posible estudiar, de que en su hogar las cosas irán mejor.

El préstamo lo usara para la construcción de gallineros, corrales, compra de 200 pollos + alimento.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 37-year-old woman, born and raised in the country. She is a mother of four children - the boys are 19, 17 and 3 and the girl is 7. Sonia devotes herself to raising them: preparing their meals, getting them ready for school - the typical tasks of a mother.

Sonia's reason for requesting this loan is that she wants to start a business of raising chickens to support her family and increase their quality of life. They are very humble people, who work 10 hours a day to be able to bring the food on the table. What Sonia wants for her family is to give them hope, and to be able to tell them that it is possible to study so things will be better in their homes.

She will use this loan to build henhouses and chicken coops, and to purchase 200 chickens and food.

loans.use: to build henhouses and chicken coops, and to purchase 200 chickens and food.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Consuelo, a sus 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 pequeños hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo, Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado como vendedora en una tienda de abarrotes, la misma que hoy en día es de su propiedad. 
Allí trabaja sola todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Su tenacidad, visión, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en el sector; sin embargo, ha sabido manejar la situación y ha aprovechado la ventaja de que el establecimiento ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el mercado.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor Como carne y legumbres, así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda. 

Consuelo, con el sueño de ampliar su negocio, se visualiza en el momento que el establecimiento esté bien posicionado en el mercado y así poder acreditarlo para que crezca y perdure en el tiempo, mejorando la calidad de vida y ofrecer un mejor bienestar y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Consuelo, at 44 years old, is a single mother of 2 young children, who she has gotten ahead with a lot of effort. During her work life she has worked as a salesperson in a grocery store, which today is her own property.

There, she works alone, every day, managing to generate enough income to pay for the basic needs of her household.

Her tenacity, vision, perseverance, and optimism have allowed her to overcome various obstacles which have arisen, especially with the great number of competitors which exist in the sector. However, she has known how to deal with the situation and has made the most of the business's advantage of already having had a long history in the market. 

Currently, she is asking for the support of a loan with which she wants to purchase an assortment of supplies in bulk such as meat and vegetables, to be able to stock up sufficiently to meet the demand. 

Consuelo, with the dream of expanding her business, visualizes herself in the moment that the business is well-positioned in the market and, so, to be able to register the business so that it grows and lasts in time, improving their quality of life and offering a better well-being and education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of supplies in bulk, such as meat and vegetables, so to be able to stock up sufficiently to meet the demand.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Four years ago, Christine recognized her love for helping others and the great number of summer homes in her area in need of caretaking.  

She thus decided to open Lower Cape Cod Caretaking and Property Management to address the need for this service in Cape Cod, a famous destination where many people have vacation homes.  

She and her husband work together to check on their clients’ properties once per week, doing everything from responding to alarm calls to overseeing projects. She hopes to use her loan to launch a marketing campaign in order to build clientele. 

She will also buy equipment to work on the property maintenance, with the vision of having the best property management company in the lower Cape Cod area.

loans.use: to launch a marketing campaign for her property management business

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en: Cheril is 28 years old and lives in Manla, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell. Cheril has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies and education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bananas

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is doing laundry for her neighbor twice a week for PHP 400. As a good mother and responsible wife, she never gets tired of supporting her husband in raising their family. Virgenia has four kids.

In order to earn more, she engaged in a snack-vending business. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own food snacks recipe. She has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

The reason why she requested another loan from PMPC is to buy additional raw ingredients for her food snacks; to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders as well for additional earnings. She hopes and prays that her business will grow. She will make other snack recipes to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her food snacks; to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders as well for additional earnings

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is a businesswoman who runs a small grocery store. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Geraldine wants to live comfortably with a concrete house. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to complete her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has a banana farm in Aloran. She and her husband are both farmers, which is their primary source of income to provide for their needs.  Gloria makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and will thus a have good income. 

Recently, she needed an amount to pay for irrigation costs of which she loaned from Paglaum MPC.  Gloria wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply more products in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor on irrigation to soften tillage pans

loans.name: Jessibel

texts.en: Jessibel is 41 years old, residing at Maular, Aloran. Jessibel is married and she joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services. Recently, she has accessed her new loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities and food products that she sells in the local community. With additional inventories of sugar, coffee, biscuits and canned goods to sell, Jessibel is confident to have good sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities and food products

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: Lani operates a motor transport business and her husband is the driver. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 (Philippine pesos) in sales every day, from which she supports her family's daily needs. To continue her business, Lani availed herself of a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repairs. She dreams to own motor units and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repairs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena has a small coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines, from which she earns a good income every quarter for her family to survive. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Elena makes it a point to do good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for the clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of coconut seedlings, so she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Elena wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products to the market.

loans.use: to pay for the clearing and plowing of land.  Also the holing and planting of coconut seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire a part time employee and buy additional computer equipment

loans.name: Oscar Gabriel

texts.es:
Oscar, desea seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y debido a los bueno resultados que tiene al invertir créditos, se ha decidido por solicitar más capital para comprar llantas, neumáticos, parches, pegamento, etc., serán de ayuda para mantener con vida el taller mecánico y reparación de llantas.
Para el sr. Oscar el crédito anterior le dio los recursos económicos para tener un mejor equipo de trabajo y atender con mayor rapidez a sus clientes, por el momento no ha tenido dificultades en su negocio, el núcleo familiar se mantiene igual y tienen un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar wants to continue strengthening his business and due to the good results that he has investing loans, he has decided to ask for more capital to purchase rims, tires, patches, adhesive, etc. They will be helpful to maintain his mechanic shop and tire repair business. 

For Oscar, the previous loan gave him the resources to have better work equipment and serve his customers more quickly. At the moment, he has not had any difficulties in his business, his family is the same, and they have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase rims, tires, patches, adhesive, etc., they will be helpful to maintain his mechanic shop and tire repair business.

loans.name: Jewels Group

texts.en:
These three members led by Joana as the representative, are part of the group called Jewels. The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling Kente cloth, assorted drinks and foot baths. They will need a total amount of GHS 3,100 to expand their businesses. The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesswomen, of which Joana is a member. 

Joana says that she joined ID-Ghana two years ago through a friend's invitation. This is her forth loan request with ID-Ghana. Joana will use her part of this loan, GHS 1800, to increase her capital. She will buy more kente cloth and sell to customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family. Joana is 45 years old, single and has one dependent child. 

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Joana replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her child and her needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more kente cloth, drinks and foot baths to sell customers.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 49 años, casada, con 1 hijo, y su negocio es la venta de ropa y accesorios para bebe.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, sensible, responsable y trabajadora. 

Su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de Medellín; un área estratégica porque tiene un alto flujo comercial; es una vitrina de la producción de la pequeña y mediana empresa, la zona es una muestra del panorama típico comercial e industrial de la ciudad. 

Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para abrir un almacén, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos y ropa para bebe al por mayor con el préstamo solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas. 

Si prestas a este préstamo estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
Luz is a 49-year-old woman, married, with one child, and her business is selling clothing and accessories for babies.

She is enterprising, independent, generous, sensitive, responsible and hard-working.

Her business is located in the municipality of Medellín, a strategic area because it has a high trade flow. It is a window on the production of the small and mid-sized business; the zone is a sample of the typical commercial and industrial panorama of the city. 

Her dream is to increase her income to open a shop. She wants to purchase supplies and clothing for babies in bulk with the loan she has requested from Corporación Interactuar to offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her sales.

If you contribute to this loan, you will be supporting the Colombian progress and drive!

loans.use: to offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her sales.

loans.name: Yesica Sofia

texts.es:
Ella es Yesica es una joven de 23 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 2 y 1, que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de cría de cerdos el cual invertirá básicamente en la compra de materiales para construcción de cocheras, comprar cerdos + alimento.

El préstamo nace por necesidad, vive con su esposa e hijos, su pareja no es capaz de generar todo el capital suficiente para el hogar, por ello ella como la mujer de la casa quiere iniciar un negocio que le permita estar cerca de sus bebes y al mismo tiempo realizar una profesión que será muy aportante en dinero para el hogar, con el cual podrán disfrutar de una mejor alimentación, vida digna y en un futuro si todo marcha bien podrán pensar en comprar la vivienda donde actualmente viven.

Yesica pide tu apoyo, solo necesita que le brindes una herramienta para labrar el futuro de su familia con sus manos.
texts.en:
This is Yesica, a 23-year-old young woman, mother of two children, ages 2 and 1, who is asking for a loan to begin a business raising pigs, which she will basically invest in the purchase of materials to build pigpens, purchase pigs, and feed. 

The loan came about from necessity. She lives with her spouse and children. Her spouse is not able to generate all the capital needed for the household, so she, as the woman of the house, wants to begin a business which will allow her to be near her babies and at the same time undertake a profession which will contribute a lot to the money for the household, with which they will be able to enjoy better nutrition, a dignified life, and in the future, if everything goes well, they can think of purchasing the house where they currently live.

Yesica asks for your support, she only needs you to offer her a tool to cultivate the future of her family with her hands.

loans.use: to begin a business raising pigs.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda is 62 years old, she has chosen to live her life single in Oroquieta City. Minda joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services. Recently, she has accessed her new loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities, food and non food products that she sells in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities, food and non food products

loans.name: Yasmith Patricia

texts.es:
Yasmith, con 39 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos y es casada.

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de calzado, con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar durante los 4 años que lleva realizando dicha actividad. 

Es una mujer emprendedora, con visión, dedicada y comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, siempre busca oportunidades que le permitan progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor de calzado, sandalias, tenis, botas, para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan y ofrecer más variedad que satisfaga los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y así poder tener mejor margen de utilidad por las ventas. 

De esta manera, Yasmith podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo primordial, que es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus pequeños hijos, brindándoles una estabilidad económica favorable para darles la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Yasmith, 39 years old, is the mother of 3 children and is married.

Currently, she works selling footwear. With this, she has managed to get resources to contribute to the sustenance of her household during the 4 years that she has been doing this work.

She is an enterprising woman, with vision, dedication and commitment to her family and her work. She always seeks out opportunities that allow her to progress. For this reason, she asks for the loan, with the end of investing it in the purchase of merchandise in bulk, of footwear, sandals, tennis shoes, and boots, to take advantage of the discounts that they have and to provide more variety to satisfy the tastes and needs of her customers, and to be able to have a better profit margin for the sales. 

In this way, Yasmith will be able to advance toward achieving her underlying objective, which is to expand her business and improve her young children's quality of life, offering them a good economic stability to provide them with the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk -- footwear, sandals, tennis shoes, boots.

loans.name: David Alejandro

texts.es:
David es un padre de una pequeña hija de ya 3 años de edad y por la cual ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerla y brindarle todo lo que necesita.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como productos para el personal, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su hija.
Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de  surtido de productos como polvos para la elaboración de batidos nutricionales, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
David is the father of a young daughter, 3 years old, for whom he has fought tirelessly to support her and offer her everything she needs.

He found, in the sale of merchandise such as personal care products, the means to generate good income while being close to his daughter.

These days, he is beginning with a small amount of capital, and is at the stage of building a customer base. For this reason, he asks for a loan to purchase, in bulk, the assortment of supplies such as powders to make nutritional smoothies, and so to be able to stock his small business with quality products.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to boost his business and will have a better variety of products to offer, managing to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make nutritional smoothies.

loans.name: Laura Pamela

texts.en:
Laura is 19 years old, married and has two small children. These is her second loan with Kubo Financiero, she repaid the first one on time. Laura is asking for a loan to continue investing in her business. 

She sales cosmetics and other personal products through a catalog. She says that her biggest accomplishment so far, is growing her business and paying her debts on time, a thing she fully expects to continue.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and other personal products for sale through a catalog

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt:
É uma jovem muito batalhadora, mãe de uma criança de 2 anos de idade, vive com a mãe que é viúva e cuida também de duas crianças filhos da falecida irmã mais nova, é cabelereira que é a principal actividade que lhe da rendimento. Tem nível médio e esta a repetir o crédito pela segunda vez, com o primeiro conseguiu investir no seu negocio na compra de equipamneto e mais produtos para o  salão de cabeleireiro.  Com o presente emprestimo pretende começar a construção de uma residência em casa de seus pais, onde vive e conta com ajuda dos seus irmãos.
Vai usar o credito para compra de: cimento, areia, pedra, barrotes e  pagar mão de obra.
O seu maior sonho é desenvolver mais a sua actividade, construir um estabelecimento próprio, pois esta actualmente a alugar bem como concluir a residência para família.
Seu maior desafio é ter que assumir papel de grande responsabilidade em ajudar a mãe nas despesas do dia a dia com a família e cuidar dos 2 filhos menores de 3 e 1 ano de idade da falecida irmã.
texts.en:
This young woman is a fighter. She is the mother of a two-year-old child. She lives with her mother, who is a widow, and takes care of her youngest sister’s two children, since she died recently. She is a hair stylist, which is how she earns her income.

She studied up to middle school and this is the second loan she receives. With the first loan, she was able to invest in her business and bought equipment and more products for her hair salon. With this loan, she plans to start building a house next to her parents’ house, where she lives with the help of her siblings.

She will use the loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron bars, and to pay for labor. Her biggest dream is to expand her business, build her own salon (she currently pays rent), and build a house for her family. Her biggest challenge is to take on the responsibility of helping her mother with the daily home expenses and take care of the two young children (aged 3 and 1) that her deceased sister left.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron bars, and pay for labor to build a house.

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 52 года, есть 5 детей. У нее высшее образование, 27 лет, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров, 25 овец. Для животных заготовлены сено и корма, на лето отгоняют на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhamila is 52 and has five children. She has a higher education and has been working in animal husbandry for 27 years as a source of income for her family, a business she started with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has six cows and 25 sheep as well as hay and feed prepared for the animals, who spend the summer at pasture. Her monthly income is about 14,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhamila has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Daniela Valentina

texts.es:
Ella es Daniela es una joven emprendedora, luchadora, una persona independiente se casó a su corta de edad por amor y vive con su pareja que es un hombre con un salario básico, ella estaba en casa realizando los destinos.

Ahora Daniela quiere ser de utilidad en su hogar, quiere junto a su marido tener una buena calidad de vida para pensar en traer hijos en unas optimadas condiciones, sin pasare pro sufrimiento para criarlos, desea un apoyo financiero para iniciar un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres en un local que ya alquilo y que espera con la ayuda del préstamo adecuar para su labor.

El negocio era antes una pizzería debe esperar a que muevan la maquinaria, pero  mientras sucede esto debe comprar estanterías nevera, dos máquinas para pesar y surtido en general de frutas y verduras, el motivo del monto es para comprar tanto el surtido como la maquinaria y sumarle las adecuaciones que deban realizarse, quedando con un pequeño dinero para futuro surtido.

Ayuda a esta joven desea tener una empresa para sostener junto a su pareja su hogar.
texts.en:
Daniela is a young, hardworking entrepreneur. Independent, she married for love at a young age, and lives with her husband who does not earn very much. She stays at home planning their future.

Now Daniela wants to do something useful and together with her husband have a better standard of living so they can raise children in optimal conditions, without worries. She wishes to obtain a loan to begin a business selling fruit and vegetables. She has already rented premises and hopes, with help from the loan, to ready it for business.

It was once a pizzeria and Daniela wants to have all the equipment moved out. While this is happening, she will buy shelving, a fridge, two scales, and fruit and vegetables. The loan money will be used both for stock and equipment as well as making the necessary alterations. A small amount will be left over for future purchases of stock.

Please help this young woman who wishes to start a business and make a home with her husband.

loans.use: start a business selling fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es:
Ella es María es una mujer de 35 años de edad, humilde, servicial y responsable que quiere iniciar un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras buscando ingreso para su hogar, ella viv3 junto con su pareja la cual hasta el momento era la encargada de generar el dinero para comprar todo, pero ella se puso a pensar de que sería de su vida si su marido no está o pelean por esa razón y pensando mucho en si misma quiere solicitar un préstamo con el que iniciaría su profesión y lo usara para la compra de 3 lavadoras y una carretilla para desplazarlas.

Este préstamo ayudara a una madre e hogar a tener un medio de sostenimiento y propio y buscar un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
This is María, a 35-year-old woman, humble, helpful, and responsible, who wants to undertake a business renting washing machines, in search of income for her household. She lives with her spouse, who up to now has been responsible for generating the money to purchase everything. But, she began to think of what her life would be like if her husband wasn't there of if they fought, and for this reason and thinking a lot about herself, she wants to ask for a loan with which she would begin her profession and which she will use to purchase 3 washing machines and a cart to move them.

This loan will help a mother to have her own means of support and to seek a better future for her family.

loans.use: to undertake a business renting washing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy car repair tools.

loans.name: William De Jesus

texts.es:
El es William, un hombre de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.

El decidió por iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de frituras desde hace aproximadamente 14 años en un pequeño carro de comidas con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por las ventas, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como papas, bolsas, servilletas y para la reparación de su carrito de comidas.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.

Es un hombre que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en: This is William, a man of character and good will, with a desire to move up and get ahead with his family. He decided to start a business of preparation and sale of fried products about 14 years ago with a small food cart and a lot of desire and motivation. He learned this job himself, with the desire and appreciation for sales, this allowed him to acquire great experience. Today,  he wants to give a small push to his business with the help of lenders from Kiva and Interactuar. This is why he needs a loan to buy supplies for his products such as potatoes, bags, napkins and to repair his food cart. With this loan he will be able to support his business and make it grow day after day. He is a man who takes on challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his products such as potatoes, bags, napkins, and to repair his food cart.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 50 years old, she is not married but she has 2 adult sons. She is a hairdresser and the beauty parlor is her property.  After many years of work, she has a little bedroom at her beauty parlor and she needs a loan to buy hairdressing products, such as shampoo, hair dye and other items.  She hopes you can help her because she supports herself alone and her family can't help her

loans.use: to buy hairdressing products, such as shampoo, hair dye and other items

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. For a living, she engages in buying and selling firewood to the local community. Marilyn has been doing this for 10 years now. She hopes to earn more profit in order to suffice for her needs. 

Therefore, she applied for a loan to pay for more firewood inventory to supply her customers. 

Marilyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to save money for other business opportunities. She wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with adequate income.

loans.use: to pay for more firewood inventory to supply her customers

loans.name: Eva Mycel

texts.en: Eva Mycel busies herself with selling assorted products. She is able to support her husband with providing for their daily needs and the education of their four children. For added income,  Eva Mycel cultivated her piece of land in Aloran. She wants to expand her business to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for funding needs and applied for a loan of 7,000 PHP. She is happy to earn an income and hopes to renovate her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a farmer, Conchita makes a good living with her coconut farm in Aloran, in the Philippines. She also runs a small grocery store business for additional earning and suffice their daily needs. Conchita has been able to send all her children to school. 

Now, she wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts and banana of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. However, Conchita is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and buying and planting of dwarf coconut seedlings. Conchita has high hopes that she will have more farm yield in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and to buy and plant dwarf coconut seedlings

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn operates a motor transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a good income everyday, enabling her to cater their daily needs. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and be able to provide more for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repair

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, vive con su esposa e hijos, manifiesta no tener ayuda familiar del extranjero; es una persona dedicada a atender su negocio de agricultura y ganadería, el cual lo desempeña de manera independiente desde hace 10 años, el oficio lo heredo de su familia y él lo práctica como fuente de ingresos.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos, también tiene pensado comprar alimento para el ganado, tendrá a su alcance los materiales que necesita para preparar el terreno, eliminar la maleza y plagas que afecten su cultivo, espera que la cosecha sea mayor que las anteriores.
Sus sueños son ser un ejemplo de superación para sus hijos y que estos sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en: Ricardo lives with his wife and children, he doesn't have any family help from abroad. He is dedicated to tend his agricutural and livestock business, which he has been managing independently for the past 10 years. He learned this trade from his family and he uses it as a source of income. He will buy agricultural supplies to grow basic grains, and he also wants to buy food for his cattle. He will have the resources needed to prepare the land, clean the brush and plagues that affect his crop. He hopes that the harvest will be greater than previous ones. His dream is to be an example of success for his children and to help them become good people in society.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies to grow basic grains. He also wants to buy food for his cattle.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie operates a motor transport business, and her husband is the driver, to support their needs. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. 

Tessie has always dreamed of living with a decent and comfortable living space for her family. To realize her project, Tessie approached Paglaum MPC to purchase light construction materials such as plywood and sticks. She is now on her way to repair and expand her house.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials such as plywood and sticks

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a farmer from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has a piece of land that she and her husband cultivate, producing rice. She has been in this business for more than two decades. 

As a mother of five, she wants to provide well for their needs. She is getting ready for the next cropping season. She accessed a loan to pay labor costs for plowing and leveling of dikes. 

She deeply wishes to fulfill all her dreams and live a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for plowing and leveling of dikes

loans.name: Fernand

texts.en:
Fernand is a farmer and makes a good earning working on his swine production business in Oroquieta. He also cultivates rice land. This is how he raises his family and is sending his children to school. 

He wants to feed all his piglets for sale after three months to gain more profit. In need of additional capital, Fernand approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins. 

He has high hopes that he will have more savings for the college education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en:
Sochea, 57, is a farmer living in a rural area of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She is also a married mother of two children. To support her living, Sochea is growing cassava and paddy rice as the main sources of income. Moreover, she sometimes works as a paid worker in order to supplement the income. Sochea, has been involved in these businesses for twelve years.

This is Sochea's fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. Now, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan which she wants to use to buy cassava seeds and fertilizers, and pay for plowing fee. She hopes that she is able to earn more income to renovate her house and make it much better than now.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and fertilizers, and pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
María Magdalena is 58 years old, married and all her sons are no longer dependent of her. She lives in a private house with her husband. For the last 36 years she has been working selling food in a small restaurant inside a Mexico City market, where her husband also has a food stall where he sells Mexican snacks.  With their savings they also aquired a taxi to have an additional source of income. 

Maria Magdalena is asking for a loan because she is finishing paying for a different position inside the market that she will use to either expand her food business or rent.

loans.use: To acquire a new position for a food stall inside the market.

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en:
Sothea is a farmer living in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. She is 43 years old and is a married mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her, one still in school. To earn a living, she grows cassava on 6 hectares of farmland. To supplement the family’s income, she works as a paid worker, sometimes. She has been involved in this business for fifteen years.

Sothea has fully repaid her past loans, and now this is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group, she is applying for a new loan to grow cassava, buy fertilizers, and pay for plowing fee and paid workers. She hopes that she can enhance her business to support her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, and pay for plowing fee and paid workers

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz has always the enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Mahayag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Paz knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. 

In the future, Paz hopes to own another rice land to cultivate for potential added income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She and her husband have been farmers, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops. This is how they earn a living. Pablita is doing and earning well doing this type of work, enabling her to sufficiently meet their needs. 

As a new member of PMPC, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and to be able to engage in agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Lady Johana

texts.es:
Lady, a sus 24 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. Ser madre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, comenzó a comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará calzado al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Lady manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Lady!
texts.en:
Lady, who is 24 years old, is a charismatic, energetic and helpful woman. Having become the mother of two children is her main motivation to fight tirelessly every day and seek for opportunities to earn a living and provide for them.

She started approximately two years ago to sell shoes to all kinds of customers. The quality and price of her shoes are excellent, which helped her to become known in the sector and earn a good reputation. She works eight hours every day.

This motivates her to request support through a loan to strengthen her inventory. She will buy shoes in large quantities with the intention to satisfy her customers’ demands. This will help her to improve the income she receives from this activity.

Lady says that her age is not an obstacle to continue doing what she loves. This is why she always sets new goals for herself, among which is the idea of becoming a great shoes distributor and employer. In this way, she will be able to improve her living conditions, and the quality of life of her family and of those people who help her to do her daily job.

Come on and lend to Lady’s business!

loans.use: to buy shoes in large quantities.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 44 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

Juliet has been in this business for years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda  is 60 years old and married with seven children.

Veneranda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Veneranda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Veneranda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 60 years old and married with eight children. She has invested her money in a hog raising business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative where she put her trust and loyalty into the institution. She availed of a loan amount of 14,900 PHP to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins. This will help her hogs to grow healthy. Aida is thankful for the aid given by the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Fellisa

texts.en:
Fellisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Fellisa dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Beverly works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Beverly is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.
