Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en: Saret, a farmer living in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, is 57 years old and the mother of seven children. For a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. Moreover, in order to supplement her family’s business she also catches fish to sell. She has been involved in these businesses for 25 years. This is Saret's second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. Saret, a group leader, is seeking a new loan to pay for plowing fee. She hopes that this loan will enables her to enhance her business to get a better income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin is 45 years old and a mother of three dependent children who are all in school. She is a rural villager living in Battambang province. Nowadays, she sells grocery items, grows cassava and feeds pig to earn income to support her family. She has been involved in these businesses for ten years. Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes her cassava will grow well through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Tikal Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango, a large town located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, has been historically known as a trading town and became the spiritual center of the Maya- Quiché. The town, often called by its full name, Santo Tomás Chichicastenango, has a maze of winding streets that surround the main plaza that is also the site of one of the most colorful markets in Central America attracting tourists from all parts of the world. The traditional “traje” or dress of the women is simply beautiful and consists of a colorful “huipil” or embroidered/woven blouse, “corte” or wrap skirt and “faja” or ornate belt to hold the whole ensemble together. The main industry is traditional textile production, a business that many women do to earn income.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tikal” is located here and consists of eight hard-working women who are determined to reach their goals. They are on their third loan cycle. Petronila, who is 35 years of age, creates beautiful traditional ensembles and has been able to generate an income for herself and her family. Her principle goal is to continue to support her children with their personal and educational needs. Petronila is also determined to partner with her husband to raise the standard of living for the entire family. She is requesting her third loan from Friendship Bridge that she hopes will be funded by Kiva lenderrs to purchase more items like various colors of thread, as well as caps and hats to sell and generate income.

The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and educational trainings is of great value to Petronila and her friends in the Trust Bank. 

Kiva lenders and Friendship Bridge are greatly valued by Petronila and the ladies in the “Tikal” Trust Bank. They are poised to step into a brighter and more prosperous future, benefiting themselves, their families and their town of Chichicastenango.

loans.use: to purchase more items like various colors of thread, as well as caps and hats to sell and generate income.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is heading into the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She needs to have enough supplies of rice fertilizer and herbicides. She also needs a new knapsack sprayer, for which he applied for a loan from the Cooperative. 

Cresencia hopes to save enough for the purchase of a rice thresher to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer and herbicides and pay for a new knapsack sprayer

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is a 57-year-old, from Aloran and married. She joined PMPC, in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she accessed her third loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 for additional working capital to buy a variety of grocery items for her existing business, which sells a variety of food and non-food products to the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items for her existing business, which sells a variety of food and non-food products to the local community

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is a hardworking mother from Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. Wilma has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Wilma hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

location.town: Ozamis-P8 San Antonio, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es: Celmira de 44 años, es madre de cinco hijos, dos de ellos menores de edad y desde su vivienda ubicada en el municipio de Barranquilla ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras a sus vecinos y habitantes del sector;  ella observo la oportunidad de ofrecer este servicio al palpar que muchos hogares no poseen este electrodoméstico que hace del lavado una actividad más confortable y aporta al ahorro de agua en comparación al lavado de ropa directamente del grifo.  Adicionalmente a este negocio comercializa electromenores como licuadoras,  planchas, abanicos, cafeteras, y también tendidos de cama que ofrece en Malambo y Galapa que son municipios del Atlántico, en donde residen familiares y conocidos.  Ella es muy comprometida con sus negocios y labora de lunes a sábado en el horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. en la actualidad y para cumplir con la entrega de unos pedidos está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en pedidos; licuadoras, cubrelechos y sábanas.  Esta inversión renovara el surtido y promete activar las ventas.
texts.en:
Celmira is 44 years old and the mother of five children, two of them minors in age. From her home in the municipality of Barranquilla she offers laundry machine services to her neighbors and inhabitants of the area. She saw the opportunity to provide this service coming to understand that many households don't have this appliance that makes washing clothes more convenient and saves water compared to washing clothing at the tap.

Besides this business she sells appliances like blenders, irons, fans, coffee makers and also bedding that is offered in Malambo and Galapa which are municipalities on the Atlantic where she has friends and relatives. She is very committed to her businesses and currently works from Monday to Saturday from 8 am until 7pm.

In order to fill some requests she is applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to invest in some orders: blenders, bedspreads and sheets. This investment will renew her stock and activate her sales.

loans.use: to invest in orders: blenders, bedspreads and sheets.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que va a incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Arsenio is 22 years old and lives in the district of Callayuc, a community were life is quiet. It's inhabitants works in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. It is located in the region of Cajamarca, in the North Andes of Peru.

He works growing coffee and has 4 years experience in this business and good references from the inhabitants of the district. He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance for his coffee crops. Doing this he hopes to offer a higher quality coffee to his clients which will increase his level of income and in the end improve his quality of ;living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to provide maintenance for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en: As a widowed parent of six children, Deria works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Deria is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to buy items such as canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loans, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is married and a father of four children. He runs a pub business and owns rental houses in the expansive Mathare informal settlements. He has had challenges in providing reliable sanitation for his customers at the bar, which has lead him to look for an alternative that will effectively counter the issue. 

He learned about Fresh Life toilets and got interested in putting up the toilets for his patrons. He seeks a loan to help him purchase and install one Fresh Life Toilet and improve sanitation around the business area as well as maintain his customers. He hopes to put up more units around this informal settlement as soon as he's cleared repaying his loan.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a marriex woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marilou has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Mila has been in this business for 10 years. Mila earns more income from general store and raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Leonisa works hard to support her family.

She has a balut vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Leonisa is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of balut to resell.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of balut to resell.

Rhodora has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Loreta

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring.  Loreta is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to  buy fishing materials like fishing nets, ice chest, etc for her fishing business.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, ice chest, etc for her business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling  fish.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets to make fish cages for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nets to make fishing cages for her business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Diana works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal. Diana is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to buy supplies to maintain her fishing boat for her fishing business. Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to college and to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing and raising pig.

Melinda dreams that one day She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 29 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Raquel has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buy and sell cashew.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and raising pigs. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 30 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Arlyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman who works hard to support her family. She has operated a native mats making business for 2 years and requested  10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Rosemarie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, uno de ellos se dedica a trabajar y el otro más pequeño estudia.
	
María, se dedica a trabajar limpiando casas, toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar, ya que ha sido madre soltera desde muy joven y tuvo que tomar toda la responsabilidad de sus hijos; ella viaja todos los días al centro de la ciudad a trabajar, desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar su vivienda, esto mejorara en gran manera su calidad de vida.

María, sueña con tener su casita en perfectas condiciones para ella y sus dos hijos.
texts.en: María is 36 years old and studied up to Grade 1. She is a single mother and lives with her two children. One of them works and the younger one studies. María works cleaning houses. She has worked all her life as she has been a single mother since she was quite young and had to take complete responsibility for her children. She travels to the center of the city every day to work from 7 am until 3 pm. She needs the loan to make improvements on her house which will improve her quality of living in a big way. María dreams of having a house in perfect condition for her and her two children.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a rug making business for 23 years.  She earns additional income operating a general store and raising pigs.

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her rug making business.

Imelda has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her rug making business.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nelma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP  through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Raquel has been in this business for 11 years. Raquel earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Eppie

texts.en:
Eppie is a 35-year-old married woman with one child who attends school.

Eppie has sold livestock for 3 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

She has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Eppie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Nena

Nena has raised pigs for 6 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.name: Eleonor

In the future, Eleonor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell.

Romilie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and raising goats. Leony is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase new fishing nets and materials to repair her fishing boat. 

Leony has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets and materials to repair her boat.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Margie is 42 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Margie has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Margie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Favila

texts.en:
Favila is 56 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Favila has borrowed and paid back 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, milk, coffee and canned goods.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 55 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from an internet café. Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF.

Dolores is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, noodles, detergent soap, and other products to sell. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, noodles, and detergent soap to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She runs a dried-fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF.

Gloria is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase boxes of fish to dry for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional recycled materials like empty bottles, plastic, iron, etc.

Lourdes has been in this business for eight years.

In the future Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional recycled materials like empty bottles, plastic, iron, etc

loans.name: Normadia

texts.en:
Normadia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell wood business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional wood to sell.

Normadia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Normadia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Roselyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Roselyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a 63-year-old married woman with nine children.  

Estela has raised pigs for 11 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies.

She has previously borrowed 20 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Estela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio trabaja en el área de transporte de todo tipo de materiales desde hace 35 años, lo hace en un vehículo de tracción animal.

Hoy en día quiere mejorar su actividad y dejar descansar el animal que siempre lo ha acompañado, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un nuevo caballo y para la reparación de su coche.

El es padre de de una hija por la que vela constantemente para que no le falte nada en su vida.
texts.en:
For 35 years Antonio has transported all types of goods using his horse and cart. Now he wants to improve his business and let this horse which has been his constant companion have a rest. For this reason Antonio is seeking a loan to buy a new horse and repair his cart. 

He has a daughter over whom he keeps careful watch to make sure she wants for nothing.

loans.use: buy a new horse and repair his cart

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bazana II Village. Samaila  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samaila will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

This season Samaila has grand plans to harvest 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Samaila now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Sichin's Group

texts.en: Sichin is 30 years old and lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He is a married father who has two dependent daughters. He struggles for a living by selling costume jewelry, and he has been involved in this business for six years. This is Sichin’s third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has successfully repaid his past loans. Leading a group of two members, Sichin is applying for a new loan to buy more costume jewelry to resell. He hopes that he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more costume jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: María de 37 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante, y proveer de los mejor a su familia apoyada en su negocio de venta de pan francés, actividad que realiza en el mercado municipal, por lo que cuenta con excelentes ingresos económicos. María vive al lado de su hijo de 9 años de edad y su esposo, en vivienda humilde pero propia. María desea construir las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que actualmente las paredes de su vivienda son de lámina lo que no le causa mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, grava, ladrillo, arena y hierro para construir las paredes de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 37, is a hard-working woman who puts forth great effort every day in order to get a head and provide the best for her family.  Her business of selling French bread supports her.  She conducts her business at the municipal market, and she gets excellent profits.

María lives with her nine year old son and her husband in her own, humble house.  María wishes to build the walls of her house as soon as possible.  The walls of her house are currently made of metal sheeting, which does not provide much security.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, gravel, bricks, sand, and iron in order to build the walls of her house.  This way she will provide her family with greater security.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, bricks, sand, and iron in order to build the walls of her house.

loans.name: Lilibeth

Lilibeth is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm supplies

Angelie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, spices, chips, etc

She supplements this income with earnings from her fish vending.

Cherry dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, yeast and margarine.

loans.name: Rosanie

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Nesa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Nesa has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Elsa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elsa, vive en casa propia con la compañía de su familia, ellos son independientes y trabajan de forma individual, por la necesidades básicas que existían en su hogar y la falta de ingresos económicos para cubrirlas, se decidió a elaborar pan para vender, su negocio lo tiene hace más de 10 años, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Con el capital podrá comprar  sal, azúcar, levadura, harinas, entre otros ingredientes para preparar la venta de pan, contará con la materia prima para seguir trabajando, aumentar su productividad y sus ventas.
Su sueño más anhelado es crecer con su negocio y tener ingresos para subsistir.
texts.en:
Elsa lives in her own house with her family who are now adults and have their own jobs. In order to afford basic necessities for the household, Elsa decided to make and sell bread, a business she has had for ten years. She works from 8 am to 5 pm.

With the loan money she plans to buy salt, sugar, yeast, flour etc, all ingredients for bread. She will then have all she needs to continue her business, and increase productivity and sales.

Elsa’s greatest dream is to grow her business and have a steady income.

loans.use: buy ingredients such as salt, sugar, yeast, flour etc. for making bread

loans.name: Cessiri N°2 Group

texts.fr:
SIDI est la personne qui a la corne de mouton  dans sa main sur la photo, c’est un cultivateur  malien, âgé de 41 ans, marié et père de 7 enfants âgées de 8 mois à 20 ans  dont  1 fréquente l’école coranique. Sa conjointe fait le ménage et le petit commerce.
SIDI  fait l’élevage et l’embouche des moutons  depuis  9 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants  et revend  dans les mêmes marchés, parfois il envoie ses animaux au marché. Le profit qu’il réalise lui permet de  subvenir aux  besoins de sa famille.
Il  emprunte de l’argent auprès de RMCR pour financer et accroitre son activité d’élevage et embouche. 
Ayant souvent confronté au problème de vente de ses animaux au marché, SIDI  souhaite  amené  lui-même ses  animaux au marché lointain c’est pourquoi il veut avoir un prêt plus  élevé dans l’avenir pour développer ses activités.
texts.en: Sidi is the one who is holding the horn of the sheep in the photo.  He is a 41 year old Malian farmer who is married and the father of 7 children ages 8 months to 20 years.  One of them goes to Koranic school.  His wife takes care of the household and has a small business.  Sidi has been raising and fattening sheep for 9 years.  He gets the sheep at surrounding markets and resells them at the same markets, and sometimes he sends his animals to markets further away.  The profit that he earns allows him to fulfill the needs of his family.  He borrows money from RMCR to finance and grow his activity of raising and fattening sheep.  Often confronted with the problem of being unable to sell his animals at the market, Sidi hopes to bring his animals to markets that are further away.  This is why he wants to take out a bigger loan in the future to develop his activities.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell after

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 42 years old, married and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. Normelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, empty bottles, etc.

Normelita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Normelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope and empty bottles.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 42 years old and married with seven children. For the past 15 years, she has been selling charcoal and she also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Linda works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF.

Linda is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 35 years old and married, with three children who are in school. Leonisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell.

Leonisa has been in this business for three years.

In the future Leonisa would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 34 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell.

Jonalyn has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig raising.

Amelia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to be able to to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Karola Yesenia

texts.es:
Desde los 22 años de edad, Karola subió al tren de los emprendedores vendiendo, de forma ambulante, ropa usada. Ahora a sus 36 años de edad es muy reconocida en su comunidad vendiendo distintos productos nuevos de uso personal y de segunda mano. Este trabajo le ha permitido salir adelante como madre soltera de dos pequeños. Esta comerciante tiene el apoyo de su hermana que le manda remeses y mercadería desde Estados Unidos, lo que le ha permitido sostener con más fuerza su negocio.  
Ahora Karola siente seguir haciendo que su negocio crezca y ofrecer mayor variedad en sus ventas. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar prendas de acero como aretes, brazaletes, collares, anillos, entre otros productos que tanto solicitan sus clientes. Esto le permitirá brindar nuevos productos y mejorar sus ventas. En sus planes está que en un futuro compre ropa de segunda mano en grandes cantidades para tener más productos.
texts.en:
At 22 years of age Karola boarded the train of entrepreneurs selling used clothes in an itinerant manner.  She is now 36, and she is very well-known in her community for selling different and new personal use products and second-hand items.  This work has allowed her to get ahead as the single mother of two little ones.  This merchant has the support of her sister, who sends her shipments and merchandise from the United States.  This has allowed her to more strongly sustain her business.

Now Karola feels like making her business grow and offering a greater variety of sales.  This is the reason that she is requesting a loan to buy steel jewelry like bracelets, necklaces, and earrings, among other products that her customers request so much.  This will allow her to offer new products and improve her sales.

Among her plans for the future is buying second-hand clothes in large quantities in order to have more products.

loans.use: to buy steel jewelry like bracelets, necklaces, and earrings, among other products.

loans.name: Upendo Wetu Group

texts.fr:
Grâce à l'apprentissage dont il a été bénéficiaire auprès de sa famille et ses amis, Léopold a adopté la riziculture depuis 2004. Sa famille et lui ont une appréciation particulière de cette activité car elle les fournit de quoi manger et assure le paiement de frais scolaires de ses enfants. Parfois la baisse du prix du riz dans le marché, les catastrophes naturelles et le manque de financement en constituent un obstacle; heureusement que PAIDEK est venu à leur secours grâce au crédit et dont ils espèrent que le rendement leur permettra d'améliorer leur niveau de vie. Léopold souhaite aussi ajouter d'autres variétés dans la qualité de paddy qu'il produit.
Présidant le groupe UPENDO WETU, sur photo, il est au centre avec un carnet à la main.
texts.en: Thanks to the training that he received from his family and friends, Léopold has been growing rice since 2004.  He and his family have a particular appreciation for this activity because it supplies them with something to eat and ensures the payment of school fees for his children.  Sometimes  the drop in the market price of rice, natural disasters and lack of financing are obstacles for them; luckily, PAIDEK came to their rescue with loans which they hope will improve their quality of life.  Léopold also hopes to add other varieties in quality that the rice paddy produces.  He is the president of the group UPENDO WETU and in the photo he is in the middle holding the card.

loans.use: pay for labor such as plowing, harrowing, hoeing and to buy phytosanitary products and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Gustavo

texts.es:
José, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachiller, está acompañado y vive con su pareja y su hijo de dos años de edad. 

José, es una persona que conoce muy bien la agricultura, específicamente se dedica a la producción de granos básicos, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de sus padres, pues él le ayudaba; su esposa se dedica al oficios domésticos.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar cemento, arena y ladrillo de obra, para la construcción de un baño de su vivienda.

José, sueña con tener en mejores condiciones su vivienda, para darles seguridad a su esposa e hijo.
texts.en:
José, age 24, went to school through high school.  He is in a relationship, and he lives with his life partner and his two year old son.

José is a person who knows agriculture very well.  Specifically, he produces basic grains.  Everything that he knows he learned from his parents because he helped them.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.

José needs the loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks to build a bathroom at his house.

José dreams of having his house in better condition in order to provide security to his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks to build a bathroom at his house.

loans.name: Melialyn

texts.en:
Melialyn is 31 years old and married, and she works hard to help her husband.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing, as well as pig fattening. Melialyn is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Melialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 44 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school. For the past 18 years, she has been a rice farmer. Bernadette has borrowed three previous loans from NTWF to sustain her business.

Bernadette is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay laborer salaries to prepare her farm for planting. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay laborer salaries to prepare her farm for planting

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell.

Lucita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns income from food vending and selling coconut.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 48 years old and married with seven children. Five of her children are currently in school. For the past ten years, Cheryl has been a rice farmer in the Philippines. She has borrowed 11 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Cheryl is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Pabla Rafaela

texts.es:
Pabla es una mujer bastante activa, que con tan solo tres años de haber iniciado con su pulpería, es reconocida por sus vecinos como la mejor en la calle. Su amabilidad, su espíritu emprendedor, pero principalmente su esposo y su hijo de dos años de edad, la ha llevado a crecer bastante rápido. Esta comerciante de 33 años de edad, también recibe el apoyo de su suegra, pues el apoyo familiar ha sido el motor de este negocio. 
Siendo pabla una mujer dinámica, quiere seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería para crecer más. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar salsas, café, azúcar, sopas instantáneas, pan, arroz, entre otros productos que tanto demandan sus clientes. Esto le permitirá mejorar su servicio e incrementar sus ganancias. En sus planes considera agrandar su negocio y convertirlo en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Pabla is a very active woman, and with only 3 years of running her general store, she is already known as the best on the street by her neighbors. Her friendliness and her enterprising spirit, but also her husband and two year old son, have inspired her to make the push to grow her business fast. Pabla is 33 years old, and she is also helped in her store by her mother in law, as well as other family members, who help to drive her business.

Being a dynamic woman, Pabla wants to continue to invest in her store and to see it grow. And so, she is asking for a loan that she will use to purchase salsas, coffee, sugar, instant soups, bread, rice and more, that her customers ask for. This will help her to provide a better service and to make higher profits. Her plans for the future are to expand her business and to convert it into a distributing center.

loans.use: purchase salsas, coffee, sugar, instant soups, bread, rice and more.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Febe works hard to support her family. She runs a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling food. Febe has been sustaining her business through her previous five loans from NWTF.

Febe is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has run her business for ten years and she also earns an income from a general store. Cherry has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Cherry is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers. In the future, she dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell to customers

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling rice and fruits.

Luz dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish and charcoal and raising pigs. Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ingredients such as meat, vegetables, fish, etc. for her restaurant business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients such as meat, vegetables, fish, etc.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 38 years old and is widowed with five children, four of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Analie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Analie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming  in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Soledad supplements this income with earnings from her buy-and-sell vegetables business and from farming citrus.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Soledad dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Regina has been in this business for five years. Regina earns more income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Herald Ernesto

texts.es: Herald, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Herald is 18 years old, he is single and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his greatest priority. With his loan, he plans to purchase fertilizers and other products to apply to his coffee crop, and so they develop well, in addition to paying for labor costs to apply the products and assistance to the plantation once the harvest is developed and, in this way, assure himself of doing good work. What he plans to do is take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions in the zone for this crop, and also to put into practice his several years of experience managing the coffee. In addition to being able to purchase better products of better quality so his crops develop well and are healthy, he also wants a good harvest and to have, in the short term, a sizable production. With the income from the harvest that he hopes to get, he wants to use it for his family's well-being and realize some family goals and continue investing more in the crops. This is the first loan that he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 29 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school. For the past eight years, she has run a general store in the Philippines.  Cresencia works very hard to provide for her family.

Cresencia is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other products. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, and other products

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Rosario has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Rosario aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Belen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Belen is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cresencia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.  Cresencia is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fruit, sugar, milk, legumes, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, and fruit

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Demetria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing, farming rice, buying and selling vegetables and pig fattening. Demetria is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Demetria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children. She farms rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation and to buy sacks of fertilizers. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Julieta dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries for farm preparation and to buy sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Ma. Venus

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Venus works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culturing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Ma. Venus is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase rope, seaweed seedlings, etc. for her seaweed culturing business.

Ma. Venus has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rope, seaweed seedlings, etc

loans.name: Ariel Alexander

texts.es: Ariel Alexander, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de herramientas y equipo que reunan las condiciones y que sean de buena calidad para trabajar en mecánica automotriz, las cuales le facilitará la elaboración de trabajos con más facilidad y eficiencia y así aprovechar el mercado que tiene en su comunidad y el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y en el periodo que tiene de práctica  y así poder tener más ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de mas herramientas y otras productos, y  también lograr un mejor acabado a los trabajos. Con esta compra pretende ajilisar los trabajos en mecánica y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ariel Alexander is 18 years old.  He is single, and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his main priority.  He intends to use his loan to purchase good quality tools that he needs to work as an auto mechanic.  This will enable him to work more easily and efficiently, and thus take advantage of the market in his community as well as make use of the knowledge he acquired in his training and apprenticeship.  In this way, he will be able to earn more income, continue investing in more tools and other products, and also attain better quality work.  With this purchase, he plans to accelerate his mechanic work and thus complete his short term jobs.   This is the first loan he is receiving from Fudescor.  He hasn’t had any other loans with state banks, but Fudescor has provided the loan with more convenience and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase mechanic's tools and equipment.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling of Avon and Natashia products.  Vilma is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance for her fishing business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Edith Arely

texts.es:
Edith, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a que sus padres no contaban con los suficientes ingresos económicos, está casada y vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de un año y medio de edad. 

Edith, se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo y tallas, esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 2 años, en ese momento observo que su esposo, necesitaba un apoyo para generar más ingresos para su familia, fue así como ella aprendió dicha labor y actualmente le apoya siempre a su esposo también en la producción de granos básicos.
    
Edith, necesita el crédito para comprar más cosméticos y ropa, esto con el fin de mejorar su negocio, ya que sus clientes le solicitan otro tipo de productos diferentes.    

Ella, sueña con que su hijo tenga mejores condiciones de vida y que se supere académicamente y que aprendan un oficio también. Además, sueña con tener una vivienda propia, que reúna las condiciones de seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Edith, 27 years old, studied just through secondary school due to her parents not having sufficient income. She is married and lives with her husband and son who is a year and a half old.

Edith works selling cosmetics and clothing of all sorts and sizes. She began to do this work 2 years ago; at that time she noticed that her husband needed support to generate more income for their family. So, it was in this way that she learned this work and currently she always supports her husband and also with growing basic grains. 

Edith needs the loan to purchase more cosmetics and clothing, with the end of improving her business, since her customers ask her for other types of different products.

She dreams that her son will have better living conditions and that he will improve himself academically and learn a profession as well. In addition, she dreams of having her own house, to meet the security conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and clothing for her business.

loans.name: Keyra Irene

texts.es:
El espíritu de ayudar a los demás, rodea la vida de Keyra, una joven de 26 años de edad que estudió Derecho, con el objetivo de resolver los conflictos legales de las personas, para que estas no sufran de injusticias. Ella es madre de un pequeño de cinco años y esposa de un hombre que es técnico automotriz, que la ha apoyado siempre. 
Actualmente Keyra no se está realizando profesionalmente, porque faltan algunos asuntos legales para que empiece a ejercer como abogada.  Por esta razón, ella solicita un préstamo para pagar el carné de abogado, el título de notario y el sello que le permiten oficialmente trabajar como Licenciada en Derecho. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres que son agricultores y quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de ver a su hija trabajar por ella misma y por los demás.
texts.en:
The spirit of helping others permeates Keyra's life. She is a 26-year-old young woman who studied law, with the objective of solving people's legal conflicts, so that they don't suffer injustices. She is the mother of a 5-year-old little one and wife of a man who is an automotive technician, who has always supported her. 

Currently, Keyra isn't working professionally because she lacks some legal items to begin to work as a lawyer.  For this reason, she asks for a loan to pay for the legal license, the notary title and seal, which will allow her to officially work as a trained lawyer. Luckily, she has the support of her parents who are farmers and who are proud to see their daughter work for herself and for others.

loans.use: to pay for the legal license, and the notary title and seal.

loans.name: Walter Hernan

texts.es:
Walter tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia en una comunidad tranquila donde la gente se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como patos, gallinas, pollos, entre otros, las ventas las realiza en su mismo domicilio, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y tambien para la compra de alimento balanceado para la crianza de los mismos, con esto el espera incrementar su negocio lo que le va a permitir obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 32 years old and lives in a house he owns in a peaceful community where the people work in trade, raising animals and agriculture, and is located in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He works raising and selling animals such as ducks, hens, chicks, and more. He sells them from his own house, and has done this work for more than 10 years, so he has experience in this business and has regular customers who offer very good personal and work references for him. The loan will be to purchase a greater quantity of animals and also to purchase balanced feed to raise them. With this, he hopes to expand his business which will allow him to get more income that will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and also to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Janeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Janeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, plastic rope, etc. for her fishing business.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Eda Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Eda Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income selling fish.  Eda Rose is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to  buy gasoline, wood, bamboo, and fishing nets for her fishing business.

Eda Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wood, bamboo, fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Salvacion is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Sokhy

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Sokhy is now 33 years old and married. She has two children; one is in school while one is too young for school. Sokhy is rice farmer who has engaged in the business for 13 years. Her husband helps to earn additional income by working as a paid taxi driver. The current business earns them about 50,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs and they can afford to save about 30,000 KHR each day. 

Sokhy is a fourth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan, which helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and generate more income for her family. Now she is applying for a loan to dig a well. She hopes to have enough water supply for use in her company.

loans.use: to dig a well

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es:
Manuel, es acompañado, ambos viven juntos y por el momento no tienen hijos; desde hce10 años se dedica a trabajar cultivando maíz, lo hace de lunes a sábado, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades al realizar dicha actividad.
La temporada de siembra se aproxima por lo que necesita de un crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar maíz, se limitará a utilizarlo únicamente para los trabajos de agricultura, su finalidad es tener un negocio más rentable, atraer nuevos clientes y resarcir su deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar trabajando para crecer con su negocio y tener un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Manuel is partnered, they live together, and for now don't have children. For the past 10 years he has worked growing corn, doing it from Monday to Saturday, work that he learned from his parents. To date, he has had no problems in doing this work.

Planting season approaches, so he needs a loan to purchase agricultural supplies necessary to plant corn. He will use it only for agricultural work, with the end of having a more profitable business, attract new customers, and pay off his debt. 

His aspirations are to continue working to grow with his business and have a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase the agricultural supplies necessary to plant corn.

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Sangkae district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Ban, 60, is a widowed mother. She has been struggling to feed her children by growing rice and selling snacks to earn extra income. Having been in the business for 12 years, she can earn about 80,000 KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs. 

Ban has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Ban wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase crop yields to earn a larger income so as to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Aisas' Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Battambang province’s Sangkae district, Aisas is aged 33 years and married with four children. She is a rice farmer who has been farming rice for ten years to make a living while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 50,000 per day from the current business and manage to save KHR 30,000 daily for future needs. 

This is the eighth loan for Aisas with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor, 54 years old, lives in a rural village of the Chueng Prey district of Kampong Cham province. Sor is a mother of five dependent children who are still in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area while her husband is a paid worker helping to support the family. Having been in the business for 36 years, Sor can earn daily income of approximately KHR 70,00 and is able to save about 40,000 KHR each day for future needs. 
This is the first loan for Sor with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. This loan will enable her to grow rice more productively. She also hopes to earn more income to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the number of birds to increase their income.

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
Saren is aged 47 years and is a mother of two children. She and her husband make a living through growing rice and working for others for a fee, which they have been doing for 27 years. The current business earns them about 29,000 KHR per day and Saren is able to save about 15,000 KHR daily for future needs. 

This is the third loan for Saren with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Saren will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow more crops to sell for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir is 43 years old and lives in Hargeisa City. He is married and has two children, both in school. Bashir has been working hard to manage his workshop to make money for his family. He makes and sells doors and windows in Hargeisa. He has requested a loan of (USD) $1,000 from Kaaba MFI to purchase the materials his business needs. The loan will be used to buy more seals to make house doors and windows. This will help Bashir generate greater profits and increase his working capital. In the future, he will be able to open up another workshop or enlarge his existing one.

loans.use: To buy more seals to make house doors and windows.

loans.name: Lyndiane Boulevard Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le 13 Juin 2008. Madame Aminata Colle qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 40 ans et mère de trois filles et deux garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente d'habits depuis plus de trois ans. Avec le prêt elle compte acheter 20 tenues pour femmes, 10 draps et 10 tenues pour hommes. Elle va vendre à crédit sa marchandise à ses clients pour un payement bimestriel. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of which this group is a part was inaugurated on June 13, 2008. Madame Aminata Colle who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is married, aged 40, and the mother of three daughters and two sons. She has worked at selling outfits of clothing for more than three years. 

With the loan she intends to buy 20 outfits for women, 10 bed sheets, and 10 outfits for men. She is going to sell her merchandise  to her clients on credit and have them pay on a bimonthly basis. The profits will allow her to help cover the school fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy outfits of clothing for resale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 61 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cirila has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Cirila requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cirila has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, Cirila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. Emelia is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Emelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Emelia has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Emelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Paying for her children's education is the big challenge that Asmahan has taken on.
She is a country woman who earns a living by selling blankets. She has three daughters and two sons and wants them to have a good quality of life.
Asmahan and her husband have managed to provide their family with a good quality of life which she wants to continue. She wants her children to have a good education and find a good work in the future.
Asmahan requests a loan to buy blankets and products to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is a hard-working married man who does welding and also sells oils and lubricants to supplement his income. He is responsible for taking care of five children, four in school, in Masindi, Uganda. He started the oil business to support his family's needs. He desires to educate his children but seasonality in the business affects his sales. He requests a loan to buy lubrication oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy lubrication oil to sell.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha is 43 years old and married, with two children.

Nuha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store for food supplies and household supplies beside her home and she requested a loan to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, sugar, eggs, and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid other loans before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from her husband`s pension.

Nuha aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, sugar, eggs, and other groceries.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 38 years old, married, and has three children, with two of them currently in school.  For 10 years she has operated an agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines.
