Andresa requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.  She has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Andresa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Felecita

texts.en:
Felecita is 51 years old and married.  She has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Felecita has borrowed and repaid 23 loans. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 48 years old and married with two children, one currently in school. Juanita works very hard to provide for her family.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like snack foods, sugar, detergent soap, cereals, biscuits, and fabric conditioners to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, sugar, detergent soap, cereals, biscuits, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is married and has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

Leonora has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 61 years old and married.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lucita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucita has been in the pig fattening business for 21 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Om Hashem

texts.en: Om Hashem is married and has 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband is a farmer, and she has a small clothing project. She works really hard to afford medication for her daughter (6 years old), who suffers from congenital defects in her bones. Om Hashem requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to expand her project and increase her income to afford medical care and medication for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nonita is 48 years old, and three of her seven children are currently in school.

Nonita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials, like abaca fiber, etc., for her business. She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nonita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials, like abaca fiber, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.

Patricia requested her ninth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Consuelo Irene

texts.es:
Consuelo, en su humilde hogar, intenta ganarse la vida con la venta de golosinas, dulces, cigarrillos, entre otros. Con estos alimentos intenta salir adelante día a día.

Vive en con dos de sus cuatro hijos en su casa los cuales la apoyan en su pequeño negocio.

Con esta actividad ha sobrevivido durante 5 años, y a pesar de los pocos ingresos y lo difícil de su vida, nunca deja su alegría y sonrisa.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de surtido de confites, dulces, insumos para sus obleas, entre otros.

Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de abastecerse y tener su negocio un poco mas consolidado.
texts.en:
Consuelo, in her humble home, is trying to make a living selling sweets, candy, cigarettes, among others. With these foods, she is trying to get ahead every day. She lives with two of her four children at home which support her in her small business. With this activity, she has survived for 5 years, and despite the low income and her life's difficulties, she never quits her joy and smile.

She is requesting financial support for the purchase of assorted sweets, candy, supplies for her wafers, among others. This loan will give her the opportunity to stock up and have her business a bit more consolidated.

loans.use: to buy assorted sweets, candy, supplies for her wafers, among others.

loans.name: Gehad

texts.en:
Gehad is married and has two children. She has a livestock fattening project that she started because the prices of meat increased and meat sales will be profitable for her as she will sell to butchers' and in the markets. The income from the project helps Gehad to afford medication to her aging and sick mother and to help her husband with the family income. 

A 5000 EGP loan will allow her to buy more animals such as goats and lambs to increase her sales and her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en: Rabee is 30 years old and single. He has a cattle fattening project and uses the milk to make cheese and butter and sells the calves. Rabee requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his income to save for his marriage.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Kuapeguai Group

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 16 años, y su negocio es la costura.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en el barrio ‘kuapeguai’ caracterizado por su población; migrantes guaraníes llegaron al lugar debido al desplazamiento hacia el norte a la zafra cañera, el Estado los reconoció como tierras comunitarias. De clima de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Adela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo hasta la alturas de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro , viste polera rosada y pantalón blanco). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; confección de cortinas, venta de ropa de segunda mano, horneado de masas tradicionales, venta de muebles, confección de polleras, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero y venta de salteñas, para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la costura, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa femenina y piensa que tomando buenas medidas se asegura la confección de una buena prenda de vestir, medidas como el contorno; de pecho, de cuello, de cintura, de caderas, de brazo, etc. Son las más importantes, “Una prenda ajustada a medida en puntos específicos según el cuerpo del cliente, es una herramienta muy eficaz para verse bien y hacer de esa prenda estándar una pieza personalizada…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de herramientas de trabajo. Su sueño es abrir un taller de costura grande para generar empleos, Ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina industrial de coser y tela por mayor. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina industrial de coser y tela por mayor para abrir un taller de costura y generar fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Adela is a 40 year-old woman who is single and has 2 children aged 9 and 16.  She  has a dressmaking business.  
Adela is a good mother who is enterprising, strong, tenacious, reliable, responsible, and very hardworking.  She carries out her work in the "Kuapegai" neighborhood, which is known for its population of Guarani migrants who came to this place after being displaced from the northern sugarcane farms.  The area has a hot, tropical climate with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Adela has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that goes down to the tops of her shoulders.  She is short in stature with a robust physique, and her native language is Guarani, which she speaks in everyday use.  She also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business.  She is seen in the center of the photo, wearing a pink shirt and white pants. She shares her life with her children, who are attending school.  They live in their own home, made of wood with a tin roof and an earthen floor.  Their home has potable water and electricity and is connected to a sewer system.

Adela's desire for success led her to lead a communal bank to request a loan with people that have a variety of businesses such as: curtain-making, the sale of second-hand clothing, bread baking, furniture sales, dressmaking (traditional style skirts), comforter sales, the production of leather wallets, and empanada sales.  She has a dressmaking business where she makes women's clothes.  She takes good measurements to ensure that her garments are well-made, such as measurements of the chest, neck, waist, hip, arms, etc.  These are very important, "a garment that is made to measure at specific points according to the body of the customer is a very effective tool to look good and make this garment a personalized piece that will serve as a standard," she comments.  

The advantage of Adela's business is that she has regular customers. The disadvantage is that she lacks some of the tools she needs for her work.  Her dream is to open a big workshop where she could employ others.  She wants to purchase an industrial sewing machine and fabric at wholesale.  This is her 3rd cycle of loans from the institution in the 9 years she has had her business.  This is why Adela is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabric at wholesale, so that she can open a dressmaking workshop and generate sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and some fabric

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 28 years old.  She is married and has one child.  Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 55 years old and married.  With three children currently in school, Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
Remedios has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena works hard to support her family.  She is married and has operate a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines for 8 years.

Serena requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell.

In the future, Serena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Victoria is 55 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Victoria has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her weaving business.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for five years now.

Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her vulcanizing business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 48 years old and married.  She has six children. Beatriz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. to sell.

Beatriz has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Beatriz aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Belinda works hard to support her family. She has a plastic wares business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.  Belinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of plastic wares to sell to her customers.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of plastic wares to sell to her customers

loans.name: Zienab

texts.en: Zienab is 40 years old, and is from Bansiwef. She is married and has three children. Four years ago, Zeinab started a small livestock fattening project and she requested two loans from TADE to expand her project.  She successfully repaid them on due dates. Zeinab requested another loan (10,000 EGP) to buy animals such as goats and lambs to increase her income and save for her son's marriage apartment preparations

loans.use: To buy animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking single woman who simply wants a safe place to come home to at the end of the day. She works long hours as a Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA), and she is proud of her daily work because it makes a difference in other people’s lives. In an effort to have a place to call her own, she bought a modest mobile home in a small community. When she bought the home, she knew that some work needed to be done, but after moving in, she realized that the home was in desperate need of new windows. The windows on her home do not close properly; therefore water enters her home every time there is a storm. Also, Angela cannot fully secure these windows at night so that she can feel secure in her own home. Angela is experiencing high energy bills due to her leaky windows. This is causing her air conditioner to run longer than necessary in order to cool her home. Angela is hoping to replace her windows so that she can not only feel safe in her home at all times, but will not suffer the effects of water damage due to Florida’s stormy season. 

Angela will use her Kiva loan to pay for new windows so that she will not have to suffer from water entering her home and causing damage during storms, but also so that she can feel safe in her own home.

loans.use: to buy new windows so that she will not have to suffer from water entering her home and causing damage during storms, but also so that she can feel safe in her own home.

loans.name: Dudley

texts.en:
Dudley is a proud United States military veteran who is devoted to providing for his wife and two children. Dudley works full time as a security guard, and he lives with his family in a modest manufactured home. 

Although Dudley and his wife live within their financial means, they have suffered several financial setbacks due to health issues related to their daughter. Dudley’s daughter suffers from a severe medical condition that she has struggled with since birth. The family has made great effort to cover all of the medical costs associated with her disability, but the financial strain on the family became too great when Dudley was deemed disabled for a period of several months, and the household’s income declined significantly. 

Dudley has since returned to work full time, and is making great strides to pay any medical bills still owed, but he is now faced with the issue of his home needing several repairs. The family’s air conditioner has stopped working due to age, and the family has been living without a working unit for some time now. It has been difficult living without a working air conditioner, as their home is often hotter than temperatures outdoors, and for this reason, Dudley has come to SELF and Kiva for help. 

Dudley hopes to improve the livability and air quality for his family by installing a new high efficiency air conditioner in their home. Not only will this loan help Dudley provide an improved living environment for his family, but it will also help him rebuild his credit over time as he repays his loan. 

Dudley will use his loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is an independent and strong single mother who has managed to provide for her child and herself despite many obstacles. Florinda has earned a living for over twenty years as a teacher of childhood development. She is proud of her work and proud of the fact that she has managed to provide for herself and her child solely on her earnings. Unfortunately, she has received very little help raising her child and supporting her household. Despite the lack of child support, Florinda has managed to prepare her child for college.

Florinda has unfortunately suffered some financial setbacks due to a family crisis that reflected poorly on her credit. Through the financial hardship, Florinda has managed to pay down a portion of her debt and has established a reasonable plan and timeline to pay the remaining balance owed. Even with her continuous efforts, Florinda has experienced difficulty obtaining funds to make a few necessary repairs to her home due to her damaged credit.

Florinda has been without a working air conditioner since October of 2014, and desperately needs to replace the unit as the region is now experiencing sweltering heat. Florinda’s home is higher in temperature inside than the daytime temperature outside, which has made her feel as if she is “living in an oven.” Florinda is hoping that SELF and Kiva can help her finance a high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve her and her child’s quality of life and make her home livable. This loan will also help Florinda rebuild her credit.

Florinda will use her Kiva loan to pay for a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve her and her child’s quality of life and make her home livable.

loans.use: to buy a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve her and her child’s quality of life and make her home livable.

loans.name: Amthal

texts.en: Amthal is married and has one daughter (2 years old). She has a livestock business. She takes really good care of her animals and regularly visits the vet to check them up. Amthal requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more animals, such as goats and lambs, to expand her business and increase her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is a United States Army veteran who is devoted to his family. Herman works full time to help provide for his family as well as assist their children with paying for college expenses. Herman’s wife Brenda retired from her previous job, but has since returned to work full time to help the family meet all of their financial obligations.

The couple had to make sacrifices in order to ensure that all of their children went to college. The family was utilizing the equity in their home in order to pay for some of these expenses; however, when the housing market crashed, the family was left without equity in their home. Herman and his wife were ultimately forced to refinance their home, and depleted all of the funds they had saved for retirement. Herman hopes that one day soon, he will finish putting his youngest child through college, and can begin to save money so that he and his wife can retire for good.

The financial strain of the ordeal reflected negatively on their credit, and has hindered their ability to finance necessary repairs to their home. Herman and his family are in desperate need of a new air conditioner to replace their broken unit that is 22 years old. The summer is fast approaching, and the family cannot afford to pay for the new unit out of pocket, so Herman has turned to SELF and Kiva for help. A new high-efficiency air conditioner would not only make their home more livable, but it will also help the family save money when compared to their current inefficient unit.

Herman will use his Kiva loan to pay for a new high-efficiency air conditioner to replace his old unit that no longer works.

loans.use: to buy a new high-efficiency air conditioner to replace his old unit that no longer works.

loans.name: Shabaan

texts.en:
Shabaan is married and has three children. He has had a cattle fattening project for five years. He previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan followed by a 10,000 EGP loan, and he successfully repaid them on the due dates. 

Shabaan is very ambitious and wishes to expand his project, so he requested a 15,000 EGP loan to buy more cattle for his project. This will enable him to increase his income and allow his wife to join him on the project.

loans.use: To buy three head of cattle.

loans.name: Abdelsalam

texts.en:
Abdelsalam is married to a housewife and they have three sons and a daughter. Two of his sons are married and live with him in the same house and his daughter is getting married soon.  

Abdelsalam has a butcher shop and requested a 5000 EGP to buy more meat to expand his project and increase his sales and income for his family.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 65 years old, widowed and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Zosima has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Zosima requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her weaving business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Zosima has been in this business for 42 years. In the future, Zosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and is married.  She has three children.  Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food and vegetable vending.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 39 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Rosalina has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 31 years old and married.  She has three children.  Mylen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Mylen has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Mylen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Saleha

texts.en:
Saleha is a widow from Banisewef. Her husband passed away in a car accident two years ago. She has one married son who lives with her in the same house, and a daughter expected to get married in a month. 

Saleha started a grocery project and now wishes to expand it. For this reason, she requested a 3,000 EGP loan to buy vegetables such as potatoes, eggplants, and zucchini.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as potatoes, eggplants, and zucchini.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Duaa is a happy, hardworking 35-year-old woman. She is married without children.

She established her beauty salon many years ago, generating her own income with which she financially contributed to her household. Now that she has been increasing her income, and she likes what she does, Duaa is an example of an ambitious lady with willpower.

Now she is applying for a loan to buy beauty products - dye and hair treatments, among other products. She hopes she can take the shop next door to expand her salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products --- dye and hair treatments.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a hardworking woman and loving single mother to her daughter. Her main focus in life is ensuring that her daughter grows up happy and healthy. Sheryl endured a traumatic experience that left her without a penny to her name and damaged credit. She has since made great strides to repair her credit as well as save funds in case of an emergency. Unfortunately, the septic system at Sheryl’s home completely failed on her, and the cost to replace the system was everything she had saved. Shortly after replacing her septic system, her air conditioning unit stopped working. In Florida’s sweltering heat, Sheryl’s home is hotter than the daytime high outside, and she and her daughter have had to live in their home without a working air conditioner for more than a month. With one income and a daughter to raise, Sheryl does not have the funds to pay for the unit out of pocket, so she has turned to SELF and Kiva with the hope that she can obtain funding to purchase a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living conditions within her home, and also help her save money on her electric bills when compared to her old inefficient unit. This loan will also help Sheryl rebuild her credit history.

Sheryl will user her Kiva loan to pay for a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living conditions within her home.

loans.use: to purchase a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living conditions within her home.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 32 years old, married, and a father to one child, age 8. He lives in Musina, South Africa, with his family and supports his two jobless brothers and his elderly mother.
 
Amos owns a small grocery shop where he makes some profits that he uses to support his family. There is a huge demand for vegetables and dairy products within his community and he would like to expand his business to supply both fresh vegetables and dairy products to his customers. 

Amos is seeking a loan to buy two refrigerators to keep the vegetables and the dairy products cool, a milk dispenser to enable him to sell milk hygienically and a stock of vegetables, milk and dairy products.

He has taken two other loans from Siza Capital and he repaid very well.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators, a milk dispenser and a stock of vegetables, milk and dairy products.

loans.name: Etab

texts.en:
Etab is 38 years old, married, and has 2 daughters.  She lives in Baniswef, Egypt with her mother-in-law, because her husband has to take care of his mother and buy medications for her. 

Etab started a livestock fattening business to help her husband with the family income.  She requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy animals such as goats and lambs to expand her business and increase her sales for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals such as goats and lamb.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is 25 years old and is from Baniswef. She has been married for two years.

Heba and her husband started a fattening project and her husband used to run the project. After her husband traveled to Cairo for a part time job, Heba became fully responsible for the project. Heba had previously requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on due dates. She believes that a 10,000 EGP loan will help her buy two heads of cattle to expand her project and increase her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy two heads of cattle.

loans.name: Nhóm 03_Thôn 2_Đông Anh_Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bình runs retail business selling construction supplies, and is requesting a loan to buy more construction supplies to resell. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children. She also leads the Nhóm 03_thôn 2_Đông Anh_Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2014, Bình joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business, and has successfully repaid three prior loans from our institution.
She has been involved in this business for seven years, and the main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 04_Thôn 3_Đông Anh_Đông Sơn. Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tâm works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Tâm is 39 years old and she is married.  She has three children. Tâm is the group leader of the Nhóm 04_thôn 3_Đông Anh_Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2014, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Tâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Tâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. Carmelita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, candies, biscuits, juice and cereals to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 41 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, candy, biscuits, juice and cereals to sell

loans.name: Genia

texts.en:
Genia is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, with four children currently in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur, and has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. 

Genia requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Genia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Amirani

texts.en:
Amirani is a 60-year-old widowed man from the village Tuzi. He lives with his son, who works at a private company and receives a fixed salary. Amirani is involved in a little agricultural activity and earns a really insignificant income. He wants expand the agribusiness and make it more productive to meet his family costs more effectively. 

Amirani decided to purchase a cow and start dairy farming. His credit requests were rejected several times, as the family doesn't have enough income. He received this credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, a start-up program which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

Amirani will purchase a cow to start producing milk products, which will be sold at the local market. He will generate a more stable income and make better living conditions for his family. 

The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards, Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 53 years old and married.  She has five children. Eugenia works very hard to provide for them.  Eugenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Eugenia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.  Eugenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 34-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, and has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 1 year.

Jessica requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is a 33 year-old young man, from the village of Gezruli. He lives with his wife, who gets monthly assistance from local government, for family's poor living condition. Ramaz was unable to start any stable job, so in order to satisfy his family's even basic needs Ramaz started anactivity as a hired daily-worker. The work is hard for him, but the family requires financial support to get rid of poverty. 

The average monthly income of the family is 150 GEL. It is hardly enough for food forthe  family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Ramaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Ramaz plans to start an agribusiness. He will purchase a steer and also a cow and start dairy farming. Ramaz and his wife will take care of the cattle and start selling milk-products at the local market. They will get the chance to acquire financial stability and generate some income. 

The couple awaits Kiva lenders help to maintain their farming business.

loans.use: To start agribusiness  and purchase cattle

loans.name: Neviene

texts.en:
Neviene is married and has one son. Her husband is a part-time carpenter. She has a beauty salon project that she started with the help of a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on due dates.

Her project became very successful, and she wishes to expand it. She requested an 8,000 EGP loan to buy a new hair salon chair and new wedding dresses for rental.

loans.use: to buy a new hair salon chair and new wedding dresses for rental.

loans.name: Mickel

texts.en:
Mickel is 35 years old and from Baniswef. He is married and has one son and one daughter. He has a carpentry project near his house. He previously requested two loans from TADE and successfully repaid them on due dates.

He wishes to expand his project, so he requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more wood to make more furniture and increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more wood for his carpentry.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Đoài Đạo Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Hương is 34 years old and she is married.  She has two children. Hương is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 thôn Đoài Đạo xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution.  Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Peregrina earns a living by selling fresh fish to the locals in the community. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman with six children. Two of her children are still attending school. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells her husband's catch. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 20 years.

She needs additional funds to boost the fishing activity. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, fish cages, and floaters. The presence of these materials could help Peregrina improve her ongoing catch and be able to sell more fish. She is also determined to manage it properly in order to improve the family's living condition.

She is hoping that she can expand her fishing livelihood and be able to continue support the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, fish cages, and floaters.

loans.name: 030919020003.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hưng has a retail business selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell.  Hưng is 25 years old. She is married and has two children.  Hưng is the group leader of the 030919020003.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of threemembers. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hưng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution to improve her business. Hưng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution. Hưng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hưng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hưng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn Trầu Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Thu has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years, raising cattle. Thu is 57 years old, and she is married with 7 children.  Thu is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 thôn Trầu xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  In 2013, Thu joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell.  Thu has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.  The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes her business will do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ma.gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like edible oil, salt, powdered milk, soap, bread, noodles, beverages and many other goods. She is a 55-year-old married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol. One of her children is still attending school.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy stock like rice, corn, toiletries, soft drinks and canned goods. She would then be able to maintain the stock in her store, which would attract more buyers to shop.

With this assistance, Ma. Gina's income will improve and enable her to pay her obligations. Thus, she would be able to maintain her capital base and start to expand her business.
 
She hopes that she can properly managed her sari-sari (variety) store business to be able to continue financing the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy stock like rice, corn, toiletries, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 53 year old married woman and a resident in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has six dependents. Her youngest child is 19 year old. She goes fishing and sells fresh fish to the local people in her community. She needs funds to augment her catch. 

 She is asking for a loan to purchase fishing net and weights. These are essentials in her day-to-day fishing activity. With the availability of these materials, it will help improve her yield and variety of fish. That will enable her to provide nutritious meals to the family and be able to continue to send her youngest child to college as well.

In the future, she  dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and weights

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old and married.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Juana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juana has been in pig fattening for 13 years and also earns income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Chaui

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Chaui works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store. 

Chaui is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish and vegetables for her food vending business.

Chaui has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish and vegetables for her food production business

loans.name: Alipio

texts.en:
Alipio is a fisherman. He earns a living by selling fresh fish. In addition to fishing, he also raises and sells hogs. He is a married man with two children, ages 16 and 18 years old, respectively. He is 43 year old and lives in Bien Unido, Bohol.

Alipio has requested a loan to buy fishing net and floaters and to purchase pig feed.  These are very important tools in augmenting both his sources of income. It could improve his catch and also enables Alipio to raises and sells quality hogs. Thus, his income will become steady and he could start to do some expansion. 

With these,  Alipio is determined to handle both his businesses so that they are successful and able to support the education of his two children for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and floaters and to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Carlos Rene

texts.es: Carlos de 36 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que se esfuerza por salir adelante, por lo que desde  muy joven inicio su negocio de cultivo y venta de hortalizas y granos básicos, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia y brindar todo lo que este en sus manos. Carlos hace dos años logro construir su vivienda en la propiedad, gracias a su negocio y en ella vive junto a sus dos hijas de 15 y 12 años de edad. Carlos desea invertir en su negocio, ya que en época de invierno el aumenta su producción y para ello necesita de enceres con los que no cuenta actualmente, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bandejas, bolsas, semillas, plantas, entre otros productos necesarios para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en: Carlos, 36, is an enterprising man who is striving to get ahead. At a very young age, he started his business growing and selling vegetables and staple grains, which is an activity that makes it possible for him to support his family and provide them with everything they have. Carlos managed to build his own house on his property two years ago, thanks to his business. In his house, he lives with his two daughters, ages 15 and 12 years. Carlos wants to invest in his business since in the winter he increases his production and because of that he needs essential items that he doesn't currently have. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Fusai to buy trays, bags, seeds, and plants, among other necessary items to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy trays, bags, seeds, and plants, among other necessary products to grow his business.

loans.name: Jamiluddin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Jamiluddin, one of Ruma’s agents. Jamiluddin is a young man who lives in Kudus, located at east of Semarang, capital of Central Java, nine hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Jamiluddin owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago.  He was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. Jamiluddin is a young guy who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. His charismatic and friendly personality makes him have many customers.

As the business grows, Jamiluddin is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community.  He knows about the importance your loan will have on his community which needs such services.  He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is married to a housewife and has two children. The only source of income for Mustafa's family is a grocery store, but his store is very small and can't cover the monthly expenses of his family.

Mustafa requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more grocery products, such as rice, oil, and pasta, to attract more customers and increase his sales, especially in Ramadan and feast seasons.

Mustafa is very ambitious and works really hard to guarantee better living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products such as rice, oil, and pasta.

loans.name: Slamet

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Slamet, one of Ruma’s agents. Slamet lives in Kudus, located at east of Semarang, capital of Central Java, nine hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. He and his wife have two children, one daughter and one son. Slamet works as a photographer and right now he is also selling mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew Ruma from a Ruma’s sales executive. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try to become an entrepreneur in technology, as well as give more contribution to his community. 

As the business grows, Slamet is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Slamet.  It will improve his business and accordingly his community, which needs access to such services.  He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Fathcul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Fathcul, one of Ruma’s agents. Fathcul lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java about two hours by plane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, he has two children, a daughter and a son. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew about Ruma from one of his friends, and after he heard of it, he decided to look for more information about Ruma from the internet.

As the business grows, Fathcul is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Given the importance of this service, your loan will be very useful to help Fathcul improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Fathcul is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Nurul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Nurul, an agent with Kiva's field partner, Ruma.  Nurul lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  She is happily married.  Together with her husband, they have two sons.  Nurul sells mobile airtime credits for her community.  She joined Ruma almost a year ago, and heard of Ruma from a sales executive that came to her home.  She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to become an entrepreneur, as well as contribute more to her community. 

As the business grows, Nurul is hoping to obtain a working capital loan from Kiva.  She will use the capital to provide additional mobile airtime credits to her community.  The loan will be very useful to help her improve her business, and consequently her community, who needs access to such services.  

Nurul is the one who is seen in the photo.  She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to help community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a zealous member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost 16 years, Lydia gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their lives and businesses. She herself has also encouraged her group, her family and her community in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, by being a good model entrepreneur. 

Lydia is a loving wife to her husband Arsenio, a carpenter, and a caring mother to their children. She gives all-out support to her husband’s carpentry skills and maximizes them through her furniture business. This has been their source of income for so many years and they have employed eight carpenters and helpers. She considers her business as a good foundation that will expand in due time with the grace of God. The couple hopes to bestow a stable business on their children in the future.

As of now, she needs additional capital to buy more materials like wood, nails, glue and canvas and additional carpentry tools. She also needs to hire more carpenters due to increasing demand from customers. The Haiyan-affected areas like Bacolod City and nearby areas have been recovering and rehabilitation is still ongoing. Hence the demand for furniture has increased. She is requesting a PHP 48,000 loan to address this need, and she is knocking at your generous heart. She won't have any problem in repaying the loan because she has gained the virtue of being a responsible entrepreneur. 
 
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for furniture making

loans.name: Faisol

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Faisol, one of Ruma’s agents. Faisol lives in Lumajang, a regency in East Java located about eight hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, he has two children, a daughter and a son. 

Faisol owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. 

As the business grows, Faisol is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Given the importance of the service, your loan will be very useful to help Faisol improve his business, and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Faisol is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Suyanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Suyanto, one of Ruma’s agents. Suyanto lives in Lumajang, a regency in East Java located about eight hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Suyanto is a young guy who has great spirit to become an entrepreneur. He decided to join Ruma because he likes Ruma's system. Suyanto sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall.

As the business grows, Suyanto is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Given the importance of this service, your loan will be very useful in helping Suyanto improve his business, and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Suyanto is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Tri, one of Ruma’s agents. Tri lives in South Tangerang, a suburban area located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. Together with her husband, she has one cute child. Tri owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits in her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago and learned of the organization from a Ruma sales executive that came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to become an entrepreneur and to contribute more to her community. 

As the business grows, Tri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Your loan will be very useful in helping Tri improve her business and provide access to services needed in her community. Tri is pictured in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to help community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer earns a living through her direct-selling business of cosmetics, food supplements and clothing. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.

Recently, Jennifer applied for a loan to purchase additional sticks and marine plywood for her house. She is on her way to repairing her own house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sticks and marine plywood for her house

loans.name: Sutilah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Sutilah, one of Ruma’s agents. Sutilah lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java located about 2 hours by plane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. 

Sutilah owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that visited her stall. Sutilah is a kind and hardworking woman, and her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Sutilah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Given the importance of the service, your loan will be very useful in helping Sutilah improve her business, and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

Sutilah is the one seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She has a small piece of rice land near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs and fertilizer. Luciana dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Dwi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Dwi, one of Ruma’s agents. Dwi lives in Madiun, a city in East Java located about 12 hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. Together with her husband, she has two children. 

Dwi owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago, and she learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that visited her stall. Dwi is a kind, friendly and hardworking woman, and her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile service provider. 

As the business grows, Dwi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Given the importance of the service, your loan will be very useful to help Dwi improve her business, and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

Dwi is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments for members of her local community.

loans.name: Sheva

texts.en:
Sheva has a hobby of listening to music and she loves to sing. She earns a meager income to support their family needs but she came up an idea to build a videoke bar in her living room. 

Sheva requested a loan from PMPC, which she will us eto buy wood sticks, paints and nails. She wishes to own "Videoke" units and put them in every store or resort so that she can also be of help to others to earn income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase wood sticks, paints, and nails

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly sells grocery items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. 

Due to the inconvenience of her living situation, Jelly thought of expanding her store into a bigger space. She requested a loan, which she will use to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for store expansion. She hopes to conveniently display her inventories.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her store expansion

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is married and has four children. She is a farmer from Mahayag. She requested her twelfth loan, which she will use to pay for labor in plowing, leveling, and cleaning of dikes, and to buy sacks of fertilizer. Vilma hopes to see all of those in her family have comfortable lives and stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for labor in plowing, leveling, and cleaning of dikes, and to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Jeronimo

texts.es:
Jeronimo tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en la parte rural del distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como operador de maquinaria agrícola, esta actividad la realiza en el distrito de Pucará y sectores cercanos, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de materiales como cemento, pintura, madera, entre otros, para realizar arreglos en su vivienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeronimo is 31 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife in the rural part of the Pimpingos district, which is in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region, located in the northern mountains of Perú. People in this district work mainly in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Jeronimo provides services as a farm equipment operator. He works in the Pucará district and nearby areas. He has experience in this business and has good references in his district. This loan will be used to buy materials such as cement, paint, and wood, among other things, to make improvements to his house and thus improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, paint, and wood, among other things, to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, está progresando con la ayuda del crédito anterior, sigue ofreciendo tostacas y  totopostes a sus clientes y ha mejorado el servicio de su molino nixtamal, las ganancias le han servido para darle mantenimiento a su equipo de trabajo y tener mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, dulce de atado, leña, aceite y otros materiales básicos para la elaboración de tostacas y totopostes, espera que las demandas se mantengan y que las pueda cubrir para tener clientes satisfechos
texts.en:
Marina is progressing with the help of her previous loan. She continues offering tostacas and totopostes (Honduran pastry snacks) to her clients, and she has improved the service of her boiled corn mill. The earnings from this have been used to maintain her work equipment and to have better nutrition, clothing, and health.

She needs another loan to buy corn, sugar cane honey, firewood, oil, and other basic materials to make tostacas and totopostes. She hopes that her clients’ demand will remain high and that she can meet the demand to keep her clients satisfied.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar cane honey, firewood, oil and other basic materials to make tostacas and totopostes (Honduran pastry snacks).

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mayra, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos; su pareja se dedica a la albañilería.

Mayra, se dedica a laborar en una empresa de limpieza de pescado, ella trabaja ahí desde hace 2 años, ella viaja todos los días menos los domingos y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

Mayra, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar medicinas para su madre, porque fue operada recientemente y no tiene el dinero para comprarlas.

El sueño de Mayra, es que su madre se recupere pronto y siga siendo la persona alegre que era antes y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mayra is 28 years old and has studied through sixth grade. She is in a relationship and lives with her partner and their two children. Her partner is dedicated to bricklaying.

Mayra is dedicated working in a fish-cleaning business. She has working in this for two years. She works everyday except Sunday, and her schedule is to work from 6:00am to 4:00pm.

Mayra is requesting a loan to buy medicines for her mother. Her mother had an operation recently, and she doesn’t have the money to buy the medicines.

Mayra’s dream is for her mother to recuperate soon and to continue being the happy person that she was before. She also wants to give her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her mother. Her mother had an operation recently and doesn't have the money to buy the medicines.

loans.name: Brenedin

texts.es: Brenedin, tiene 37 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con su padre en una aldea que pertenece al Municipio de San Luis, Santa Bárbara. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijoles y café. Su mayor fuente de ingresos es el café y vende café de calidad en la zona de Santa Bárbara. Además obtiene otros ingresos realizando trabajos de jornal. Solicita un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes e insumos para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café para sacar mejor cosecha. Tiene planes a futuro de comprar un terreno para seguir cultivando café y ampliar la producción.
texts.en:
Brenedin is 37 years old, he is single and lives with his father in a village belonging to the San Luis Municipality, Santa Bárbara. 

He has earned a living all of his life from cultivating maize, beans and coffee. His main source of income is coffee and he sells high quality coffee in the Santa Bárbara area. Also he obtains other income doing labour work. 

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 lempiras (approx. $460 US) to purchase fertilizers and supplies to help him better maintain his coffee farm and obtain a better harvest. 

He has future plans of buying a terrain to continue cultivating coffee and to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies to help him better maintain his coffee farm

loans.name: Pablo Andres

texts.es: Pablo de 42 años vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en vivienda propia. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad, es este trabajo el que le permite llevar el pan diario a su familia, su esposa le ayuda al con los gastos económicos de su hogar gracias a una pequeña venta de productos básicos que está ubicada en su lugar de residencia. Él desea construir una pared divisoria en su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con un cuarto dormitorio, pero además el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado y en época de invierno el agua ingresa deteriorando sus pertenencias, es por esta razón que él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento ladrillos hierros arena y grava para construir la pared y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pablo is 42 years old, he lives with his wife and their three children in their own home. 

He earns a living providing security services, this work allows him to bring home the daily bread for his family. His wife helps him with the economic costs of their home thanks to a small amount of sales of wholesale commodities located in their residence. 

He wishes to build a dividing wall in his house, since it does not have a fourth bedroom. But also the roof of his home is damaged and during winter water gets in a damages their belongings. This is the reason why he has applied for a loan from FUSAI, in order to invest in: cement bricks, iron sand and gravel to build the wall and change the ceiling of his home.

loans.use: to invest in: cement bricks, iron sand and gravel to build the wall and change the ceiling of his home

loans.name: Jarlin

texts.en: Jarlin is 35 years old and known in the Ozamiz area for her farming business. She actively participates in various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, in a decent house, and has applied for a loan to buy plywood, nails, and sticks. Jarlin hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, and is committed to have a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, because the  financing needs of her retail business are supported by our institution.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.es:
Rosa, elabora comida para vender, actividad que desarrolla hace 2 años, tiene un horario de trabajo de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde; es soltera y aún vive con su mamá, por su experiencia en el negocio no representa dificultades en mantenerlo en el mercado.
Invertirá carnes, pollo, verduras, frijoles, arroz, bebidas, etc., para elaborar una mejor variedad de platillos, espera que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el menú que les ofrece y con su atención.
Su objetivo es que las ventas aumenten y que la situación financiera mejore para cancelar su deuda y compartir con su madre un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa makes food to sell; this is work she started 2 years ago. Her schedule is to work from 7 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon. She is single and still lives with her mother. Because of her experience in the business, she doesn’t have any difficult in staying in the market.

She will invest in meat, chicken, vegetables, beans, rice, drinks, etc. to make a variety of dishes. She hopes that her clients are satisfied with the menu she offers them and with the service.

Her goal is for her sales to increase and for her financial situation to improve so she can pay off her debts and share a better quality of life with her mother.

loans.use: to invest in meat, chicken, vegetables, beans, rice, drinks, etc. to make a variety of dishes.

loans.name: Lilian Sarai

texts.es:
Lilian, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y vive con sus dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Lilian, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años, fue su madre quien la indujo a que comerciara con ropa, ella viaja a venderles a clientes en específico y también sale a vender a las comunidades aledañas, todos los días por las tardes.

Lilian, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa y surtir más su venta, porque se está quedando sin capital para seguir invirtiendo.

Lilian, sueña tener un bazar de ropa, el cual administraría sin problemas, también sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Lilian is 35 years old, she studied until bachelor level. She is married and lives with her two children, and her partner who earns a living as a bricklayer.

Lilian has earned a living selling clothes for 6 years, it is her mother who introduced her to trading clothes. She travels to sell them to specific clients and also goes out to sell them in nearby communities daily.

Lilian need the loan to purchase more clothes to stock her small business better, because she is left without capital which she can continue investing. 

Lilian hopes to have a clothing bazaar, which she would run without problems. Also she dreams that her children might become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and stock her small business better

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blankets and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродчон живет и работает в  районе Кубадиен. Там же у него отец и мать. Муродчону 26 лет.  Он молодой дехкан на родном районе. Муродчон вовремя делает свои обязанности, и помогает родителям  в работе.  Он единственный сын в семье. И он заботливый сын и любить своих родителей. Работа на земле не легкий труд, но Муродчон не боится трудности.  Он выращивает разные овощи. Для урожая нужны минеральные удобрения, чтобы их купить ему не хватает средств. Таким образом, он срочно нуждается в кредите. Муродчон в дальнейшем хочет стать хорошим дехканам в родном районе.
texts.en: Murodjon lives and works in the Qubadiyon region. His mother and father also live there. Murodjon is 26 and is a young farmer in his native region. He currently does his duty and helps his parents with their work. He is the family's only son. He is a caring son and loves his parents. Farming is not easy work, but Murodjon is not afraid of hardship. He grows a variety of vegetables. He needs fertilizer for the crops but does not have enough money to buy it. He urgently needs a loan. Murodjon wants to become a good farmer in his native region.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joko

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Joko, one of Ruma’s agents. Joko lives in North Bogor, a suburban area in West Java located about a one hour and thirty minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He is happily married. He and his wife have two cute daughters.

Joko owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Joko is a hardworking guy, as well as a family minded person. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Joko is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Joko improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. Joko is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to help community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Sri, one of Ruma’s agents. Sri lives in North Bogor, a suburban area in West Java located about a one hour and thirty minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She is happily married. Sri owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She already joined Ruma almost a year ago. She knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her stall and she decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Sri is a kind and cheerful woman and her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Sri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sri improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. Sri is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is juggling running her business and supervising the renovation of her home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. She is thankful that all her financing needs for her farming business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Jodilee

texts.en:
Jodilee is 28 years old, married, and a resident of Oroquieta, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have three children, of whom two are in school.

Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (variety store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April of 2013 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. She wants to own a mini-mart someday in the future, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Kristanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Kristanto, one of Ruma's agents. Kristanto lives in Depok, a suburban area located about a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children. Kristanto owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma last year and he decided to join Ruma because he has an interest in Ruma's service and system. Kristanto is a hardworking man and his community sees him as a friendly and trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Kristanto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. Kristanto’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Kristanto is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.
