texts.en: Len is a 22-year-old single student from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She is in her first year of a bachelor’s degree, majoring in nursing, at a university in her province. Her parents are rice farmers. Len is requesting a loan because she lacks the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the third year. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn skills to achieve her future goal. Len dreams of finding a better job with a reasonable salary, and she also wants to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the third year

loans.name: Furidah

texts.en:
Furidah is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.

Furidah operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are individuals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest.

Elizabeth operates a retail business where she sells maize flour, sugar, rice and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are individuals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, sugar, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, rice, sugar, milk and other items

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a female Kiva borrower with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regulars.

Winnie will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years.

She will use the anticipated profits to open another grocery store.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 32000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell  for her general store business.

Marivic has been in this business for 20 years. Marivic earns more income from buy and sell gasoline.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children, two of whom in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like spices, canned goods, bread, noodles, eggs, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Dina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like spices, canned goods, bread, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and raising pigs.  Milagros is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa is 47 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Elfa has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell ready to wear.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aisa Joy

texts.en:
Aisa Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase stocks of bamboo to weave and pays for laborers salaries for her bamboo weaving business.

Aisa Joy has been in this business for 4 years. Aisa Joy earns more income from general store and raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Aisa Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of bamboo to weave and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Ma. Melisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Melisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear. Ma. Melisa is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Ma. Melisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa works hard to support her family. Sitti Hawa is married and has a buy and sell pineapples business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of pineapples to sell.

Sitti Hawa has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Sitti Hawa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of pineapples to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 55 years old married with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

Merly has been in this business for 9 years.  In the future, Merly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina, 62 years old, is married and has four children. She has an agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines. Crispina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Crispina has been in pig fattening for 3 years and has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. Crispina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 51 years old, is married and has six children. She has an agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines. Monica has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Monica has been in this business for 4 years and has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a farming fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and new seeds.

Gloria has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and new seeds

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Adela has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her business. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Adela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 46 years old, is married and has three children. With two children currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Marilyn has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as coffee, milk, cereals, shampoo, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, etc. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more of these items. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as coffee, milk, cereals, shampoo, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 55, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children.

To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business. She primarily grows rice and sesame and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 2.50 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Expectacion

texts.en:
Expectacion is 54 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school,.  Expectacion works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling Avon, MSE and Natasha in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Expectacion has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Expectacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store to sell

loans.name: Julay

texts.en:
Julay works hard to support her family. Julay is married and has a dried fish maker business in the Philippines.

Julay requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Julay has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from .

In the future, Julay would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 35 years old and has two children.  Emerlyn is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Emerlyn requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emerlyn has been pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emerlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a buy and sell live fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase more live fish to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more live fish to sell

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 33 years old and single. She has an agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Melissa has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melissa has been raising livestock for 3 years and has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Melissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Junay

texts.en:
Junay is 56 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

Junay has been in this business for 10 years.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 59 years old, married and works hard to help her husband.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish.  Nida is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old and has a live-in partner with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 45 years old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and mangoes from his shop.

Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase more variety of fruit from the fields and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to expand his business in the future.

Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mulyadi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Mulyadi, one of Ruma's agents. Mulyadi is a young guy who lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma last year. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he has been learning how to improve his business. He feels that he can give more contribution to his community through his small business as well. Mulyadi is a hardworking guy and his community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business runs along, Mulyadi needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Knowing about the importance of this to him, your loan will be very useful to help Mulyadi improve his business and also for his community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Mulyadi is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 59, is originally from Kampong Cham Province. She is the mother of 7 children. 

To earn a living and support her family, Van manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland. She primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. She is able to earn USD 5 per day. 

Van resides a bit far from the local water source, so it is hard and time-consuming for her to collect water. For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited to build a well for her household's use.  

With help from this loan, Van hopes that she will easily access water and spend less time collecting it. She is thankful to Kiva's lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well for her household

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn works hard to support her family. She is married with one child, and she has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rizalyn has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to resell. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

Rizalyn would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Elba Milena

texts.es:
Elba, a sus 61 años de edad vive con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos.  
Desde que tenía 16 años, ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, pues le colaboraba a una Tía que tenía una empresa grande y allí se encargaba de pulir y revisar las prendas, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad fue vinculada a la empresa, donde laboró por algunos años. 

Hace aproximadamente 30 años, Elba se independizó y montó su taller con gran empuje; afianzó su taller con la esperanza de que las ventas aumentaran y así fue, comenzó a conseguir contratos con terceros. De esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 

Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una fileteadora industrial, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los contratos y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una línea propia, además de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Ella sabe que Interactuar es un gran apoyo para el crecimiento de su empresa!
texts.en:
Elba is 61 years old and lives with her husband and four children.

She started working, making clothing, when she was 16 years old.  She used to work for one of her aunts who had a large workshop and she used to polish up and inspect garments.  When she reached adulthood, she became an associate of the workshop, where she remained for a few years.

About 30 years ago, Elba went out on her own and started her own workshop.  She financed it in hopes that her sales would increase and they did.  This is how she was able to obtain new contracts and support her family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy a commercial filleting machine so she can create well manufactured items for her customers, with excellent trimming.  This way her contracts will increase and she will be able to achieve her dream of having her own line of clothes and create jobs for others.

She knows that Interactuar is a great supporter for growing her company.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty, 44, is married with three children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 10 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children who are now getting a degree in college. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. 

She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her future grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase for additional stocks and now she is re-applying a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia has always dreamed of opening and managing her own retail store to support her needs.  Virginia is married and lives in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. She applied for a loan to restock her store with inventory items such as food and non food commodities. In the future,  Virginia hopes to expand and improve her business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with inventory items such as food and non food commodities

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely has always been an enthusiastic farmer who has grown rice on his land and has a banana farm in Mahayag. He consistently has a good yield and strong earnings from his work, but would like to be even more productive. 

That is why he has applied for a loan to prepare his land and seedbed and ensure that his rice field is ready for planting. Ely knows that he has to get things right to earn a higher income in the upcoming season. In the future, he hopes to buy a multi cab to haul his produce to market.

loans.use: to pay for the preparation of his land and seedbed and ensure that his rice field is ready for planting

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 52 years old and lives in Casusan, Aloran, Philippines. She is married with four adult children. She is good at doing her farming activities and has had this business for more than a decade.  She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to grow more produce. She recently became a member of Paglaum MPC.  In the future, Letecia hopes to venture into a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to grow more produce

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Janice works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Janice is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her fishing business.

Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Criselda is 40 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Criselda has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Criselda has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married with five children and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 8 years now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nona is 31 years old and has one child still in school.

Nona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Nona has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Analyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to  buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maria Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell woods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional different woods to sell.

Maria Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional different woods to sell

loans.name: Rini

texts.en:
Rini has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island.

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Rini heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Rini, who is also a healthworker in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area.

Rini will use this loan to buy about 20 filters and sell them on to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is 45 years old married woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons and her husband is an auto repairing mechanic by profession. He has been running an auto repairing workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He has also spare parts in the workshop for exchange in auto during repairing. 

He needs to purchase some tools for his auto repairing shop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the necessary items. Therefore his wife, Meena is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. Meena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for her husband's auto repairing shop

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rina has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Rina heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Rina, who is also a leader of her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

This loan will allow Mrs. Rina to buy 40 filters and sell them on consignment to her neighbors, making safe drinking water available to 200 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Dyah

texts.en:
Mrs. Dyah has a family of three and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Dyah heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Dyah, who is also a leader of her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

This loan will allow Mrs. Dyah to buy 40 filters and sell them on consignment to her neighbors, making safe drinking water available to 200 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Lilis, one of Ruma's agents. Lilis lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children (one daughter and one son). Lilis owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. She knows Ruma from sales executive who came to her stall and explained about Ruma. Lilis feels excited joined Ruma because since she was joining Ruma, she learned more about how to expand her business using technology, as well as give more contribution to her community.

As the business runs, Lilis is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Lilis improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Lilis is the one who is standing and carrying one of her children. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 30 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her 8 years old daughter and her husband. Her family owns 4 hectares of rice fields.

In 2003 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kunthea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses and to buy diesel and fertilizer for her fields. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk, pay for dyeing and loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is a hardworking mother of four children.  She has been a widow for five years, and bravely raises her family from the income of her eatery.  She is thankful that Paglaum Cooperative guides and supports her all the way.  Now, Cherry needs additional capital for her eatery to purchase new sets of kitchen utensils and ingredients for her new menu.  She plans to pay her loan even before its maturity and re-apply again for her expansion.

loans.use: to buy new sets of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia lives in Ozamiz and supports her child by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paints & pay her workers

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Cerela has supported her husband doing this type of work.  

Like a farmer, Cerela has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Cerela hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in healthier, heavier and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is 59 years old and married with five children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. For the past 10 years, Isidra has been in a banana chips making business. Isidra is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients for her banana chips business. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her banana chips business

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
Esteban and his wife have been running a landscaping business in Florida for over 5 years. Originally from Colombia, Esteban works to support his wife, one of his daughters, and his wife’s relatives. Esteban’s first loan successfully allowed him to expand one part of his business, landscaping. The other part is exporting tractor parts for agriculture in Colombia. 

He will use this loan to develop this other aspect of his business. He currently employs four people, and his goal is to further expand the business and “help out good people by creating jobs.” He works hard and recognizes that the success of his business is dependent on his effort, determination, and imagination.

loans.use: to have working capital for his landscaping and tractor business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a 60-year-old woman. She lives with her two daughters, five sons and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile shop for the past 10 years. He sells new mobiles and mobiles accessories such as chargers, batteries, hands frees, bluetooth devices, etc. in his shop. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone he has built up very good relationships with his customers. 

Therefore Razia's son requested a loan so that he would be able to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hands frees, and bluetooth devices to increase his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her son would be able to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's mobile phone shop business

loans.name: Anees

texts.en: Anees is a 34-year-old married woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter and her husband is an auto-repairing mechanic by profession. He has been running an auto-rickshaw-repairing workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He also has spare parts in the workshop to be used in the auto repairs. He needs to purchase some tools for his workshop. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. Therefore, his wife, Anees, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. Anees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. for her husband's auto rickshaw-repairing business

loans.name: Dona Vie

texts.en:
Dona Vie is a single woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dona Vie is 30 years old and both of her children are presently in school.

Dona Vie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dona Vie has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is from Phnomsrok, a village in the northwest of Cambodia, one hour away from Angkor temples. She is 37 years old and lives in a wooden pile house with her husband. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of rice fields. 

In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against the rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sophorn makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses and to buy fertilizer for the fields. 

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk, pay for the dyeing, and for preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies for the sale of "api" (a traditional beverage), to open up a snack shop, and pay expenses for her children.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 40 years old and married with one child. Cherryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cherryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Cherryl has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geraldine is 48 years old and has one child still in school.

Geraldine has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy computer spare parts and other materials for her business.

Geraldine has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts and other materials for her business

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia works hard to support her family. Lucresia is married with four children and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lucresia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Lucresia has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 50 years old and has three children. She is single and two of her children are currently in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Irene has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married with five children and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Delia has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from food processing.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina works hard to support her family. Charina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Charina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Charina has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena, age 45, is a mother of six children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Zareena, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase the needed things such as a tailoring machine, needles, thread and fabric with the help of the loan. Zareena is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, thread and fabric for her husband's tailoring work

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un negocio en el que vende ropa. Inicio el negocio hace 10 años y ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.
Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospera. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como ropa para hombre y niño.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Gloria is a driven woman who is ready to face the world and to make an effort toward a fulfilling life. She runs a business selling clothing, which she started 10 years ago and which has been embraced in the area. She wishes to expand her selection of products and improve her sales, investing capital in her business. For this she is requesting a loan that will give her the opportunity to prosper.

Gloria will invest the money in merchandise that she does not yet carry, such as clothing for men and children. She has great hope in her business and thinks her future can get considerably better thanks to the support of organizations such as Interactuar, who make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise she does not yet carry, such as a clothing for men and children.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Judelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Judelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

Judelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 50 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Rowena has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials to her business and pay for her laborers' salaries.

Rowena has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business and to pay for her laborers' salaries

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
A sus 29 años de edad Sandra logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que tuvo trabajando en talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina fileteadora con la que podrá expandirse a nuevas empresas y tener mejor volumen de trabajo dándole la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así un día contar la historia de que gracias a colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At age 29 Sandra managed to establish her own business of third-party clothing manufacturing and her own clothing line. She was enabled by her workshop experience, and she worked Monday through Saturday for 9-11 hours per day depending on the amount of work to be done. She knows that she has a good business thanks to her customers.

Sandra wants to broaden her horizons and offer employment to people in need. She is requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, which will enable her to expand her sales to new businesses. The increased volume of work will give her the opportunity to hire someone to work.

Her dream is to keep growing and to create a workshop, so that one day she may tell the story of how she was able to build a great business thanks to the contributors and lenders of Kiva, with help from the Interactuar organization.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, which will enable her to expand her sales to new businesses.

loans.name: Nighat's Group

texts.en:
Nighat is the age of 49; she is a mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her son sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from the milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He wants to increase his income through the milk sales business. So, Nighat requested a loan. In this way, she can support her son's business.

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's milk sales business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is age 20 and still single. She owns and manages a retail store in her village and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 daily. Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase beverages, chips, canned goods, candies, noodles, and sugar to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, chips, canned goods, candies, noodles, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jovelen

texts.en:
Jovelen is a single woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jovelen is 28 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Jovelen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jovelen has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a married woman, 56 years old, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ligaya has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and other materials for her business.

Ligaya has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jean is 49 years old and all of her children are presently in school.

Mary Jean has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 57 years old and married with three children. Sandra works very hard to provide for them.

Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, drinks, etc.

Sandra has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonides is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leonides has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

Leonides has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Leonides would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter.

Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. Her son is a shoe maker and is very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. He sews shoes made of leather and rexine with his sewing machine, after that, he attaches its sole through stitching by his hands. 

In this way he is getting income for his family. He has been making shoes at home and wants to buy some raw materials for his shoe making work. But he does not have the amount to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy the initial raw material for making shoes.
She is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her son's shoemaking work

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa lives at Tuguegarao City. She is 51 years old, married, and had five grown up children. Her spouse provides transport business for their income. They use the income to sustain their daily needs at home, like meals and electric bills. 

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to invest in the transport business. They will buy gasoline and oils needed in maintenance of the motorcycle. They wanted to continue offering safe travel to all their passengers. She also promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and oils needed in maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell shoes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy bundles of shoes to sell for her buy-and-sell shoes business.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of shoes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling processed food. Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and other supplies to use for her business.

Ma. Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other supplies to use for her business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Con la comercialización de sus hortalizas y frutas, Víctor ha podido construir una vida junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos.

Esta actividad viene ejerciéndola hace aproximadamente 10 años y la aprendió a través de un amigo con el cual antes era socio.

Luego de un tiempo decidió independizarse y buscar sus propios ingresos, fue asi como termino en este negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas y hortalizas para surtir su inventario y aumentar su capital de trabajo, pues con este negocio es que pagara la educación de sus hijos y mejorara su vivienda.
texts.en:
Victor has been able to build a good life for himself, his wife, and three children by selling fruits and vegetables.

He has been doing this for about 10 years and he learned from a friend who used to be his partner.

Later he decided to go out on her own and find her own income.  This is how he ended up in this business.

He is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables to stock his business and increase his working capital.  He will pay for his children’s education and make improvements to his home with the money he earns in this business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Heun

texts.en: HEUN, 32, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of one child. She is a rice farmer and earns, on average, an income of USD 2,50 a day. To make more money, she wants to run a business of selling sugarcane juice. However, she doesn’t have enough capital investment to run the business. That is why she is applying for a KIVA loan to buy a machine to make sugarcane juice. She hopes that this loan will help to earn more money for her family. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make sugarcane juice.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 55 years old and has five children. Flaviana is a married woman.

Flaviana is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Flaviana requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flaviana has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flaviana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Avelina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from her general store. Avelina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Avelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is 29 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Annaly works very hard to provide for them.

Annaly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, and other groceries.

Annaly has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Annaly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre emprendedor que trabajó durante años en diferentes empresas, pero hace un tiempo decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio en casa. 
El trabaja en la venta de ropa para dama todos los días desde las 9:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. 

Sergio utilizará el crédito solicitado a la Corporación Interactuar para comprar al por mayor surtido de ropa para dama, calzado, accesorios, entre otros.

El sueña con acreditar el negocio y con poder incrementar sus ingresos, que le permitan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sergio is an entrepreneurial man who has worked for years in different business, but a while ago he decided to start a small business in his house. He works selling women's clothing everyday from 9:00 am until 9:00 pm.

Sergio will use the loan requested from the Corporacion Interactular to buy in bulk a selection of women's clothing, footware, accessories among other things.

He dreams of registering his business and being able to increase his revenue, which would allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy in bulk a selection of women's clothing, footwear, accessories, among other things.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, 43, is a married woman living in the small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She has four children.  To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farm located near her home.  She grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers.  

Him earns an income of 5 USD a day, and is applying for KIVA loan to buy a plot of land to build a house in the future.  She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Gloria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gloria es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace unos meses cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 65 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de uniformes; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la Compra de insumos para confección como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, botones, entre otros, para abastecer su taller, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.
Gloria sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Gloria is a business woman who is dedicated and hardworking. She works as a seamstress, providing service to others. 

It all began a few months ago when she was working as an operator in a tailor's shop. Today she is 65 years old and has her own shop. She works everyday and her strength is making pants and blouses for uniforms. In this way she generates sufficient income to support her husband with the financial burden of the home.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in buying supplies for sewing, such as cloth, thread, needles, lace, and buttons, among other things to stock her shop. In this way she will be able to fill her customers' requests and deliver the orders in a timely manner. In the end, increasing production and acquiring new contracts, which will allow her to continue her small business.   

Gloria dreams of strengthening her business and each day having an improved level of production to create new opportunities for work and to improve her family's quality of life, as well as the quality of life of those who are daily influenced by her work.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, such as cloth, thread, needles, lace and buttons, among other things to stock her shop.

loans.name: Niamone Kassankill Group

texts.fr: Ce banc villageois est inauguré le 21 Février 2001 suite à la bonne entente du groupe. Ces femmes ont les mêmes objectifs. Madame Khady qui est à la droite de la photo est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 40 et mère de quatre enfants dont trois garçons et une fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de poisson sec, elle capitalise une expérience de plus de huit ans. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité 20 paniers de poisson sec. Vu la qualité de son produit elle écoule rapide sa marchandise. les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge des frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en: This 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on February 21, 2001 because of the positive understanding of the group. These women have the same goals. The group's representative is Ms. Khady, who appears at the right in the photo. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother of four children (3 boys and a girl). She is active in selling dried fish. She capitalizes on over eight years of experience. She is going to use the loan requested to purchase 20 baskets of dried fish. Given the quality of her product, she sells her merchandise quickly. The profits will be used to help cover the family’s food costs.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: Mohamad Group

texts.en:
Zahra is the featured borrower of Mohamad group, and is cooperating with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua.  Her group have always been neighbors and friends and are working hard to develop a living.  Zahra is the lady at the far right side of the picture.

Zahra is a 26-year-old single lady, who has been working at running her mobile phone and accessory shop, in addition to her teaching job as a French teacher in a private school, to support her three additional family members for whom she is the sole breadwinner.

The acquired Al Majmoua loan will be invested in diversifying her mobile phone sector, and developing her business to increase her income and meet her family's needs.  This is her eighth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good payback back history.  Her previous loans helped her starting and develop her own business in a well managed way.

As for the other group members, Dana is at the center, while Fatima is the lady at the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: to diversify her mobile phone sector, and develop her business.

loans.name: Niamone Kassankill Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 15 femmes est constitué par des liens d'amitié, de proximité et d'affinité. Ce sont des qui ont femmes les mêmes objectifs de réussite. Madame Kadidiatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentant du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de six enfants dont cinq garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de l'huile de palme et du jus de citron depuis plusieurs années. Elle va acheter avec le crédit sollicité 75 litres d'huile de palme et 60 litres de jus de citron. les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: This group of 15 women is built upon ties of friendship, proximity, and affinity. They all have the same goals. Ms. Kadidiatou, appearing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 45 years old, and the mother of six children, including 5 boys. She has been active in selling palm oil and lime juice for several years. She is going to use the loan requested to purchase 75 liters of palm oil and 60 liters of lime juice. The profits will be used to help cover the children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and lime juice

loans.name: Arabiatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce banc villageois est inauguré le 21 Février 2001. C'est un groupe constitué de dix femmes qui ont les mêmes objectifs de réussite dans le commerce. Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 37 ans et mère de sept enfants dont cinq garçons. Cette dame s'active dans le commerce de miel depuis plusieurs années. Elle compte acheter 40 litres de miel de qualité. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge des frais de nourritures.
texts.en: This 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on February 21, 2001. It is composed of ten women who have the same goals of succeeding in commerce. Ms. Fatou, appearing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 37 years old, and the mother of seven children, including 5 boys. This lady has been active in the commerce of honey for several years. She intends to purchase 40 liters of quality honey. The profits will be used to help cover food costs.

loans.use: to purchase honey

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana una persona emprendedora desde siempre, quien ha emprendido varios negocios con el fin de encontrar una sostenibilidad económica, está incursionando en el mundo de la belleza con sus servicios de cepillado, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas, etc. Con el cual ha generado ingresos para sostener su hogar.

Espera crecer mucho más su negocio, en un futuro poder tener su propio local de belleza y posicionarse en el mercado de un forma segura.

Su dificultad más grande es la competencia.

El crédito será utilizado para adquirir los muebles, equipos y productos de belleza (maquillaje, plancha, sprays, cremas de peinar, etc.) con los que podrá ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Liliana has always been an enterprising person who has engaged in various businesses with the aim of financial stability. She is getting into the world of beauty now, offering her brushing, make-up, nail services, etc. With these she is generating the income to support her household. 

She hopes to grow her business much more, and in the future be able to have her own beauty salon and to position herself securely in the market .

Her biggest challenge is the competition.

The loan will be used to buy the furniture, equipment and beauty products (make-up, a flat iron, sprays and hair cream, etc.) she needs to offer higher quality service.

loans.use: to buy the furniture, equipment and beauty products (make-up, a flat iron, sprays, hair cream etc.) she needs to offer a higher quality service.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA 1sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N’Tjila dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame Lala  assise en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena et à  SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 163 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “KOTOGNOGONTALA 1” are married women, who average 47 years of age and five children each, living for the most part in traditional families in N’Tjila, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are now on their 7th loan with the institution; the past loans have indeed been paid back.  

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. Lala, who is sitting first from the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to pay for three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer, a container of herbicide, and plowing to maintain: 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers paying with cash in Niena and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 163,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Kounassou 01 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Kounassou 01 est formé de deux femmes battantes et Kadidia est la responsable. Ce groupe est à son 20ème contrat de prêt avec l'institution mais jusque là il n’y a pas de problème, les remboursements se font correctement. Kadidia, membre représentatif est veuve et mère de 3 enfants.Cette brave dame fait du dèguè( un mélange de yaourt et des grimo fait à base de petit mil) et un boisson appelé zoom koom au Burkina.Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter du lait destiné a faire le yaourt, du petit mil et aussi du sucre et les autres ingrédients nécessaire pour faire le déguè et le zoom koom. Après se ventes, Kadidia aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire les dépenses de sa famille et de continuer son activité.
texts.en: The group Kounassou 01 is composed of two determined women, and Kadidia is the group’s official. It is on its 20th loan contract with the institution. And so far, there has not been any problem. The payments were made correctly. Kadidia, the representative member, is a widow and the mother of three. This good and honest woman makes dèguè (a mix of yoghurt and grimo, made from pearl millet) and a beverage called zoom koom. After her sales, Kadidia will have a profit enabling her to cover family expenses and continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk for producing yoghurt and some pearl millet for making zoom koom, a local drink in Burkina

loans.name: Julieta Amparo

texts.es:
Julieta es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Julieta desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Julieta tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Le dedica 4 horas diarias a su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio, gozar de buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking person. Thanks to her daily effort she has been able to support her family. A long time ago she started selling products of personal use through catalogues, and with a lot of effort she has overcome many problems. 

She currently has a lot of orders from her customers but because she doesn’t have enough capital, she needs a loan to buy products of personal use and fulfill her clients’ needs. Every day she dedicates four hours to her business. 

Her biggest dream is to make her business succeed, have a good quality of life and a better financial stability. She knows all of this will be possible with the help of Interacturar.

loans.use: to buy products of personal use.

loans.name: Wendlassida Group

texts.fr: Ouinlassida, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Cette brave dame, vend des condiments et aussi des céréales. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter un peu de condiments( tomates,épices, oignon, courgette,...) et aussi des arachides pour vendre. Cette brave dame est très accueillante, ce qui lui permet de maintenir sa clientèle. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra d'augmenter le volume de son activité et aussi d'aider son époux à faire les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Ouinlassida, the representative member, is a married mother of four. This good and honest woman sells condiments and also grains. She has need of this loan to purchase some condiments (tomatoes, spices, onions, zucchini, …) and also peanuts to sell. This good and honest woman is very accommodating, thus allowing her to keep her customers. After her sales, her profit will enable her to increase her business volume and also to help out her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and condiments to sell
